## Decree-by-Law No. 145 of 2025
### Amending Certain Provisions of Law No. (67) of 1983 Concerning the Establishment of the Public Authority for Minors' Affairs

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 M,
- And the Civil Code issued by Decree-by-Law No. (67) of 1980, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (47) of 1982 on the establishment of the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
- And Law No. (67) of 1983 concerning the establishment of the Public Authority for Minors' Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشؤون القصر</orig>,
- And upon the submission of the Minister of Justice,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,
- We have issued the following Decree-by-Law:

### Article One
The texts of Articles (3, 4, 6 last paragraph, 7, 13, 14, 18, 21, 23) of the aforementioned Law No. (67) of 1983 shall be replaced with the following texts:

### Article (3):
"The Authority shall have a Board of Directors constituted as follows:
1 – The Minister of Justice, as Chairman.

2 – The Director General of the Authority as Vice-Chairman.
3 – Three part-time members representing the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig>, and the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, from among those holding leadership positions and their equivalents, who shall be nominated by their respective entities. A decision shall be issued by the Council of Ministers – based on a proposal by the Minister of Justice – seconding them for a term of four years, renewable once."

### Article (4):
"The Board of Directors shall convene upon the invitation of its Chairman or his deputy. The Board's meeting shall not be valid unless attended by at least three of its members, including the Chairman or his deputy.
The Board's decisions shall be issued by a majority of the members present. In the event of a tie, the side on which the Chairman voted shall prevail.
The Board shall have a secretary who shall be responsible for recording the minutes of its meetings.
The Board of Directors may – when necessary – seek the assistance in its meetings of such specialists and experts as it deems necessary, without them having the right to vote. Their remuneration shall be determined by a decision of the Board of Directors."

### Article (6) (last paragraph):
"The Board may form one or more committees from among its members and others to decide on certain matters falling within its jurisdiction. The matters to be presented to each committee, its scope of jurisdiction, its powers, and the procedures for its meetings and the issuance of its decisions shall be determined."

### Article (7):
"The Authority may, with the permission of the Board of Directors, undertake the following actions:
(a) Disposing of real estate when the disposal transfers ownership or establishes, alters, or transfers a principal or ancillary real right.
(b) Disposing of movables, personal rights, or securities, except for what falls within ordinary administrative acts.
(c) Accepting or rejecting conditional donations.
(d) Investing and liquidating funds, either by itself or through a third party.
(e) Undertaking or liquidating commercial, industrial, or agricultural activities, either by itself or through a third party.
(f) Leasing real estate for a period of more than three years, or for a period extending more than one year beyond the minor reaching the age of majority, either by itself or through a third party.
(g) Executing dispositions made by the decedent after it has been established that the decedent was bound by them.
(h) Voluntary fulfillment of obligations proven to be against the estate or against those under its care.
(i) Determining the necessary maintenance for those whose affairs it manages and for their dependents.
(j) Determining what is to be spent on preparing housing or on the marriage of those whose affairs it manages.
(k) Waiving or diminishing rights or securities.
(l) Settlement and arbitration.
(m) Partitioning the minor's assets by mutual consent.
With the exception of the actions stipulated in clauses (c), (f), and (k), the Board may delegate some of these powers, with or without certain restrictions, to the Director General of the Authority, another of its employees, or a committee formed by it.
In application of the provisions of Article (137/2) of the Civil Code, the actions stipulated in the preceding clauses from (a) to (m) are those for which a guardian – other than the Authority – must obtain permission from the court before carrying them out."

**Article (14):**
"Upon receipt of the notifications stipulated in the preceding article, the Public Authority for Minors' Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون القصر</orig> shall take the necessary measures to safeguard the rights of minors or unborn fetuses, and to make an inventory of their immovable and movable assets, all their rights, and all their obligations. An inventory report of these assets, rights, and obligations shall be drawn up, containing a description that removes any ambiguity, to be kept in the estate file. For this purpose, the Authority may open locked premises in the presence of one or more adult heirs after notifying all adult heirs, or in the presence of a member of the Public Prosecution. It may also take possession of and manage the funds and establishments.
The provision of this article shall apply to all others under the care of the Authority."

**Article (18):**
"The court may appoint a guardian ad litem to represent them in the pending lawsuit if the interest of a person of incomplete legal capacity, a person lacking legal capacity, a missing person, an absent person, or the charitable third conflicts with the interest of the one who holds guardianship, custodianship, or curatorship over any of them, as the case may be."

**Article (21):**
The Authority's guardianship over those under its care, in accordance with the provisions of this law, shall terminate in the following cases:
1- The minor reaching the full age of twenty-one Gregorian years, unless the court deems it necessary to continue the custodianship upon the request of the Authority or the concerned parties, as well as upon the death of the minor or the return of legal guardianship to the father.
2- The lifting of the interdiction on the interdicted person, the return of the absent or missing person, or the identification of the unknown person, based on a ruling from the competent court.
3- The issuance of a ruling by the competent court to terminate the Authority's guardianship over any of those under its care if it deems it to be in their best interest.
The Authority must hand over the assets in its possession – whether immovable or movable – to the concerned parties whenever its guardianship over any of those under its care ceases, within a period not exceeding six months from the date of its notification thereof. The handover shall be conducted by virtue of a report signed by the Director General of the Authority <orig>المدير العام للهيئة</orig> or his representative. If the concerned parties fail to receive their assets within a period not exceeding three months from the date they are summoned to do so, without an excuse acceptable to the Authority, the Authority shall continue to manage, invest, and grow their assets, provided that in this case it shall charge a percentage determined by the Board of Directors, not to exceed (20%) of the net investment return. The provision of Article (22) of this law shall apply to this amount."

**Article (23):**
"Members of the Authority's Board of Directors and its employees are prohibited from disclosing secrets, information, and data they have obtained in the course of their work.
It is not permissible for them, their spouses, their relatives or in-laws in the direct line of descent up to the second degree, or anyone for whom they act as an agent, custodian, or curator, to purchase or lease any assets belonging to those for whom the Authority acts as custodian or curator, or supervises their custodians or curators, or the assets of the thirds that it manages. Nor may they sell, lease, or exchange any of their own assets with the Authority in this capacity, whether directly or indirectly, even if by public auction.
Any transaction carried out in violation of the preceding paragraph shall be null and void."

**Article Two**
Two new articles, numbered (6 bis, 21 bis), shall be added to the aforementioned Law No. (67) of 1983, with the following text:

**Article (6) bis:**
"The Authority's Board of Directors shall form a permanent committee of representatives from the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, who shall be selected based on the nomination and approval of its Board of Directors. This committee shall be exclusively responsible for preparing investment strategies and policies for the funds of minors, persons of incomplete or no legal capacity, the assets of the thirds, and other funds managed by the Authority, as well as for monitoring their implementation and conducting investment operations in all related fields in accordance with the laws regulating this matter and in a manner consistent with the provisions and principles of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.
The Minister of Justice – in coordination with the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> – shall issue a decision on the committee's working system, which shall include its working mechanism and procedures, and all other provisions necessary for the exercise of its competencies."

**Article (21) bis:**
"The Minister of Justice shall issue a decision on the rules, conditions, and procedures by which the summonses and notifications stipulated in Articles (4, 13, 14, 21) of this law are to be carried out."

**Article Three**
The Prime Minister and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdictions – shall implement this decree-law, which shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into force from the date of its publication.

In light of all the foregoing, and as the Amiri Order was issued on 10/5/2024, Article (4) of which stipulated that laws shall be issued by decrees-by-law, it was deemed appropriate to prepare the present draft decree-by-law to amend the provisions of the aforementioned Law No. (67) of 1983.
The first article of the draft stipulated the replacement of Articles (3, 4, 6 last paragraph, 7, 13, 14, 18, 21, 23) of the aforementioned Law No. (67) of 1983 with other texts that include several amendments to the situation in the existing law, as follows:

**First:** Reconstituting the Authority's Board of Directors in a manner that ensures the representation of entities relevant to the Authority's work on its board, thereby guaranteeing its performance effectiveness. The board will be chaired by the Minister of Justice, with the membership of the Authority's Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> as Vice-Chairman, and three part-time members representing the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig>, and the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, from among those holding leadership positions and their equivalents. They shall be nominated by their respective employers, and a decision shall be issued by the Council of Ministers – upon the proposal of the Minister of Justice – to second them for a term of four years, renewable once.

**Second:** Providing a more detailed regulation for the mechanism of convening the Authority's Board of Directors' meetings and its exercise of duties, in a manner that ensures the smooth, regular, and consistent conduct of meetings and keeps pace with the changes in the Board's composition. Meetings shall only be held upon the invitation of the Chairman or his deputy. At least three members must attend the meeting, including the Chairman or his deputy. The Board's decisions must be issued by a majority of the members present. If the votes are tied, the side of the Chairman shall prevail. The Board of Directors is granted the right to seek the assistance of specialists and experts it deems necessary for matters requiring their expertise, without those whose assistance is sought having the right to vote. The remuneration for those whose assistance is sought shall be determined by a decision of the Board of Directors.

**Third:** Granting the Authority's Board of Directors the right to form one or more committees from among its members or others to decide on certain matters within its jurisdiction. The Board shall specify in its decision the issues to be presented to each committee, its scope of jurisdiction, its powers, and the procedures for its meetings and decision-making. This is a change from the existing law, which limited committee formation to members of the Board of Directors. This amendment allows for the inclusion of non-members in these committees when necessary. The draft has deemed it appropriate to leave the provisions, regulations, conditions, and all related matters concerning these committees to a decision issued by the Board of Directors based on its assessment and judgment.

**Fourth:** Granting the Authority the right – with the permission of its Board of Directors – to conduct or liquidate commercial, industrial, or agricultural businesses, lease real estate, and invest or liquidate funds, whether by itself or through third parties, which provides it with the flexibility to choose the appropriate mechanism to do so.

**Fifth:** Requiring adult heirs and partners in assets to notify the Authority within two weeks of the death of any person who died leaving minors or an unborn fetus, of the birth of this fetus, and of the death or absence of the guardian or chosen trustee. This is a change from the existing law, which required them to notify the Mukhtar <orig>مختار</orig> of the area, a position that no longer exists due to the issuance of Decree-by-Law No. (5) of 2024 abolishing Law No. (40) of 1966 concerning Mukhtars <orig>المختارين</orig>.

**Sixth:** Requiring all persons and entities to provide the Authority with the data and documents in their possession that it requests and that are necessary for the exercise of its jurisdictions, in a manner

**Seventh:** Obligating the Authority to prepare an inventory report of the assets, rights, and obligations immediately upon receiving notifications regarding its receipt of the funds of those under its care. This report shall include all necessary details to identify them in a manner that precludes any ambiguity, and it shall be kept in the estate file to ensure the Authority safeguards the funds of those under its care.

**Eighth:** Granting the court the right to appoint a litigation guardian in the event of a conflict of interest between a person of incomplete capacity, a person lacking capacity, a missing person, an absent person, or a charitable third (`الثلث الخيري`) and the interest of the person who holds guardianship, custodianship, or curatorship over any of them, as the case may be, to represent them in the pending lawsuit. This is in contrast to the existing law, which limited this right of the court to persons of incomplete capacity only, excluding other cases, despite the similarity of the underlying reason, which necessitated explicitly stipulating it.

**Ninth:** Adding other cases upon the occurrence of which the Authority's guardianship over those under its care terminates, in accordance with the provisions of this Decree-Law. This is done by explicitly stipulating the case of the return of the absent or missing person, or the identification of the unknown person, based on a ruling from the competent court, while also granting the competent court the right to terminate the Authority's guardianship over any of those under its care if it deems it to be in their best interest, in any other case besides those mentioned in this law.

**Tenth:** Balancing the interest of the Authority in not being burdened with managing, investing, and developing funds over which its guardianship has ended, with urging the concerned parties to promptly receive their funds. The Authority shall be obligated to hand over the funds in its possession, whether real or movable, to the concerned parties once its guardianship over any of those under its care has ceased, within a period not exceeding six months from the date of its notification thereof. If the concerned parties fail to receive their funds within a period not exceeding three months from the date they were called to do so, without an excuse acceptable to the Authority, the present draft has deemed it appropriate to grant the Authority the right to manage, invest, and develop their funds. In this case, it shall charge a percentage determined by the Board of Directors, on the condition that it does not exceed (20%) of the net investment return, to be allocated for what serves the public benefit for all the purposes for which it was established.

**Eleventh:** Ensuring the non-disclosure of the Authority's secrets and preventing conflicts of interest between the members of the Board of Directors and the employees of the Authority and the interests and funds of those under its care. This is achieved by expanding the scope of the prohibition stipulated in the existing law, such that the present draft Decree-Law includes a provision stating that it is not permissible for members of the Authority's Board of Directors or its employees to disclose any of the Authority's secrets they have become aware of by virtue of their work. Nor is it permissible for them, their spouses, or any of their relatives or in-laws in the direct line of descent up to the second degree, or for anyone for whom they act as an agent, custodian, or curator, to purchase or lease any property from the funds of those over whom the Authority holds custodianship or curatorship, or supervises their custodians or curators, or from the funds of the thirds (`الأثلاث`) it manages. Nor may they sell, lease to it in this capacity, or exchange with it any of their own property, whether directly or indirectly, even if through a public auction. This is in contrast to the existing law, which limited the prohibition to members of the Board of Directors and its employees only, without addressing the disclosure of secrets.

Article Two of the present draft Decree-Law stipulated the addition of two new articles to the aforementioned Law No. (67) of 1983, numbered (6 bis, 21 bis). Article (6 bis) stipulated that the Authority's Board of Directors shall form a permanent committee of representatives from the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, nominated by it, which shall have the supreme authority in determining the rules and programs for investing the funds managed by the Authority. It was deemed appropriate to delegate the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>, in coordination with the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, to issue a decision regulating all provisions necessary for the exercise of its jurisdiction. Meanwhile, Article (21 bis) entrusted the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig> with the authority to issue a decision that includes the necessary rules, conditions, and procedures for sending and receiving all summonses and notifications stipulated in Articles (4, 13, 14, 21) of the aforementioned Law No. (67) of 1983, in a manner that ensures the objective of this procedure is achieved, especially as some of them result in financial and punitive consequences of utmost importance, as set forth in this law.

Article Three of the presented draft Decree-Law obligates the Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers - each within their respective jurisdictions - to implement it, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.
<page_end>5</page_end>

# Decree-Law No. 146 of 2025
## Approving the Final Account of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation and its Subsidiaries for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for the preparation of general budgets, supervision of their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
- And Decree-Law No. (6) of 1980 establishing the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig>, as amended by Law No. (54) of 1982,
- And Decree-Law No. (43) of 2024 linking the budget of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries for the fiscal year 2024/2025,
- And the Decree issued on 17/1/1981 regarding the financial principles related to the marketing of crude oil and gas belonging to the State by the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig>,
- And based on the proposal of the Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### Article One
The Final Account <orig>الحساب الختامي</orig> of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries for the fiscal year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows:
- Revenues amounted to KWD 30,063,705,000 [Thirty billion, sixty-three million, seven hundred and five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only] in accordance with Table No. (1) attached to this Decree-Law.
- Expenditures amounted to KWD 28,697,808,000 [Twenty-eight billion, six hundred and ninety-seven million, eight hundred and eight thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only] in accordance with Table No. (2) attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Two
The net profits of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries for the fiscal year 2024/2025, amounting to KWD 1,365,897,000 [One billion, three hundred and sixty-five million, eight hundred and ninety-seven thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only], shall be transferred to the Corporation's General Reserve <orig>الاحتياطي العام</orig>, in accordance with Table No. (3) attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Three
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdictions – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

### Article (2)
The provisions of this Decree shall not prejudice:
1. The right of units subject to the supervision of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> or others to own real estate in accordance with the provisions of the law.

Therefore, we have decided the following:
First: To terminate the restructuring procedures of Aman Takaful Insurance Company, with all its ensuing effects, and to archive the original application No. (2023/1 Restructuring) in the electronic records of the Bankruptcy Administration.
Second: To accept the two precautionary applications No. (2023/241, 2024/18 Bankruptcy Declaration) and to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures against Aman Takaful Insurance Company, and to set the date of the first application submission as the provisional date for the suspension of payments.
Third: To assign the Trustee, Rabia Saad Al-Muhanna <orig>رابعة سعد المهنا</orig> – the trustee appointed in the original application – with the task of inventorying the assets and properties of the aforementioned company held by all public and private entities, preparing an updated financial statement and a list of debts and creditors' claims, while taking all necessary precautionary measures for this purpose, as a first phase. She is to complete and submit her report on this matter within a maximum period of six months, commencing from the date of publication and announcement of this decision in the Official Gazette. The trustee's fees for the first phase are estimated at a total amount of (5,000 K.D.) five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, of which an advance payment of (3,000 K.D.) three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> is due.
Fourth: To publish and announce the decision in the Official Gazette and to notify the concerned parties thereof.

Secretary
Bankruptcy Judge

In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, the decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge shall be considered executory instruments under this law. The Bankruptcy Administration shall affix the executory formula to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.

- And upon the Decree issued on 4/4/1979 regarding the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig> and its amendments.
- And upon Law No. 70 of 2020 concerning the practice of the medical profession and its ancillary professions, patients' rights, and health facilities.
- And upon the Civil Service Council <orig>مجلس الخدمة المدنية</orig> Decision No. 5 of 2010 concerning the positions and salaries of Kuwaiti physicians and dentists, and its amendments.
- And upon the approval of the Higher Committee for the implementation of the provisions of Articles 80 and 81 of Law No. 70 of 2020, formed by Ministerial Decision No. 179 of 2022, pursuant to its meeting No. 33 held on 08/07/2025.
- And upon Administrative Decision No. (1812) of 2025 on the formation of a committee to establish the necessary technical and financial controls and standards for reviewing and updating the specializations that fall under the designation of a rare specialty in human medicine and dentistry.
- And upon the letter from the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> No. 3945/2025 dated 22/07/2025, which includes the approval of the proposed updated list of rare specialties for physicians and dentists.
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

- Has Decided -
## Article One
The text of Article 16, paragraph [d] of the aforementioned Civil Service Decision No. 5 of 2010 shall be replaced with the following text:
Physicians and dentists shall be granted a rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig> in the following cases, in accordance with the following conditions:
- Obtaining a higher specialization qualification (doctorate or its equivalent) in the field of rare specialties according to the table attached to this decision.
- Obtaining a sub-specialty in the field of a rare specialty after obtaining the primary board certificate in the higher specialization (doctorate or its equivalent), in accordance with the table attached to this decision.
- The required number of holders of rare specialty certificates shall be determined according to the table attached to this decision.
- Placement in rare specialty fields shall be according to the vacant positions specified in the attached table. Secondment or transfer is permissible upon the request of the concerned department and after the approval of the competent technical committee and the endorsement of the Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig>.
- The physician is entitled to receive the rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig> as long as they are actively practicing the work assigned to them in their specialty and at their designated location.

## Article Two
Paragraph (c) of Article (9) of the Service Council Decision No. (4) of 2008, which stipulates working in the field of a rare specialty for those holding a higher specialization qualification (doctorate or its equivalent) in a non-rare specialty, on the condition of occupying the position of Senior Registrar <orig>مسجل أول</orig> or higher for a period of one year in a rare specialty center, as referred to in Article (16), paragraph (d), clause (3) of the Civil Service Council <orig>مجلس الخدمة المدنية</orig> Decision No. (5) of 2010, shall be repealed.

## Article Three
In the event a physician works in the government sector, they shall be paid the specialization allowance <orig>بدل الاختصاص</orig> and the increase in the rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig> in accordance with the stipulated controls and conditions.

## Article Four
When combining work in the government sector and the private sector, the payment of the specialization allowance <orig>بدل الاختصاص</orig> and the increase in the rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig> for the physician shall be suspended. In the event the physician returns to work in the government sector, the payment of the rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig> is conditional upon the availability of a vacant position in their specialty, according to the table attached to this decision, and after the approval of the competent technical committee and the endorsement of the Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig>.

Article Five
The competent technical committee shall be formed by a decision from the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>, in accordance with the following competencies, and shall submit its decisions to the Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig> for approval:
- Deciding on the eligibility for or continuation of the disbursement of the rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig> through the evaluation of professional performance and performance indicators.
- Re-evaluating the need and vacancies for the specialties mentioned in the table attached to this decision, at a maximum of every three years, and taking the necessary measures to remove any of the specialties if the rarity no longer exists, while ceasing the disbursement of the rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig> for those who have not previously received it.

Article Six
Reviewing the work centers of doctors in rare specialties prior to the issuance of this decision and working to redistribute them according to vacancies to determine eligibility for the increase in the rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig>.

Article Seven
The rare specialty allowance <orig>بدل التخصص النادر</orig> shall be due for disbursement starting from the budget of the fiscal year 2026/2027.

Article Eight
This decision shall be communicated to whom it may concern for its implementation, shall be effective from its date of issuance, shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and any provision that contradicts its articles shall be repealed.

Minister of Health
Dr. Ahmed Abdulwahab Al-Awadhi <orig>د/ أحمد عبد الوهاب العوضي</orig>

Corresponding to: 11 August 2025 AD

## - Decides -
### Article One
Requirements and regulations for licensing a private pharmacy:
Clause One: Conditions and requirements to be met for opening a private pharmacy:
1. Kuwaiti Pharmacist:
Completion of the application form for opening a private pharmacy (Kuwaiti pharmacist) submitted to the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, which must include a valid photocopy of the following documents:
a. Civil ID.
b. Nationality certificate.
c. A university degree in pharmacy recognized by the competent authority, and its equivalency if the degree was issued from outside the State of Kuwait and attested by the official authorities.
d. A certificate of appointment clearance for those working in the government sector.
e. An experience certificate for more than 10 years of practical experience in the field of pharmaceutical services.
f. License to practice the pharmacy profession in the State of Kuwait.
g. A certificate of good conduct and behavior proving that no judgment has been issued for a crime prejudicial to honor and integrity, unless they have been rehabilitated.
h. A certificate from the Public Institution for Social Security proving non-employment in the government sector.
i. A signature authentication letter from the Public Authority for Manpower.
2. Cooperative Societies:
The application shall be submitted to the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>:
a. A cooperative society whose activity extends to more than one residential area shall be granted a license to open one pharmacy or a branch thereof in each area, provided that each license is issued in the name of a separate Kuwaiti pharmacist, after the approval of the Minister of Health.
b. A Kuwaiti pharmacist may open a pharmacy in the central markets belonging to cooperative societies, provided that each license is issued in the name of a separate Kuwaiti pharmacist who meets the conditions stipulated in item 1 of Clause One of this Article, after the approval of the Minister of Health.
3. Private Hospitals:
To license a pharmacy for each private hospital, it is required that the number of beds therein is not less than (50) beds. The pharmacy license shall be affiliated with the hospital license, after obtaining the approval of the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> to inspect the pharmacy premises and its compliance

The hospital has the right to open another pharmacy location, provided it is in the same connected building and that only one of them is directly connected to the road.

Clause Two: Pharmacies of companies, individuals, and cooperative societies licensed to a non-Kuwaiti pharmacist, and private hospitals, must commit to appointing at least one Kuwaiti pharmacist who holds a license to practice the pharmacy profession.

Clause Three: The license of a private pharmacy shall be revoked as soon as the pharmacist holding the license begins employment in government agencies or any institutions, companies, or bodies affiliated with the government sector.

Clause Four: The validity period of a private pharmacy license is four years.

## Article Two

### Conditions and Regulations for Licensing Private Pharmacies:

Clause One: Conditions and requirements that must be met to issue a new private pharmacy license:

1. A distance statement certificate issued and authenticated by the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> showing that the nearest pharmacy to the premises of the pharmacy for which the license is sought is no less than 400 square meters in all directions of the circular perimeter, starting from the central point of the pharmacy for which the license is sought to the central point of the nearest pharmacy. Excluded from this are pharmacies located in cooperative societies, similar central markets, commercial associations, private hospitals, medical centers, and airports.
2. The area shall not be less than 40 square meters and the height shall be two and a half meters.
3. A sketch map of the premises for which the pharmacy license is sought, showing its location and a detailed description of its spatial and technical specifications.
4. The pharmacy must not be connected to another residential dwelling, whether this connection is direct or indirect.
5. The pharmacy must be directly connected to the road, with the exception of those in cooperative societies, similar central markets, commercial associations, private hospitals, medical centers, and airports.
6. It must be located on the ground floor, with the exception of those in cooperative societies, similar central markets, commercial associations, private hospitals, and airports.
7. A lease agreement concluded between the Kuwaiti pharmacist applying and the owner of the premises.
8. The most recent rent receipt for the premises.
9. A certificate from the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> showing the automated number of the building and unit.
10. A Celsius thermometer inside the pharmacy, with the temperature inside the pharmacy not to exceed 25 degrees Celsius.
11. A Celsius thermometer in the pharmacy's storeroom, if any, with the temperature not to exceed 25 degrees Celsius.
12. A refrigerator for storing medicines, equipped with a Celsius thermometer, with the storage temperature therein being between 2 and 8 degrees Celsius.
13. Availability of air conditioning, ventilation, lighting, and shelves designed for storing and displaying medicines and medical products.
14. A securely sealed cabinet specifically for expired medicines.
15. A securely sealed cabinet specifically for both narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances in pharmacies and all health facilities affiliated with private hospitals.
16. Medicines or medical products stored or displayed in the pharmacy must not be exposed to direct sunlight.
17. The custody records for medicines subject to ministerial decisions must be certified and approved by the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
18. Compliance with the special conditions and requirements of other official bodies, which must be valid, namely:
    a. License from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
    b. License from the General Fire Force <orig>الإدارة العامة للإطفاء</orig>.
    c. Facade advertisement license from the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.
    d. Signature authorization from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
19. A safe transport and disposal certificate issued by the competent authority at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, stating that a contract has been made with the company tasked with the management, operation, and maintenance of the medical waste treatment plant affiliated with the Ministry of Health.

Clause Two: The Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> shall audit all documents and data submitted by the applicant for the pharmacy license, verify that the required conditions are met in the pharmacy premises, and approve them by conducting a preliminary inspection. It will then issue a preliminary approval valid for one year from its date of issuance. This approval is not considered a license to conduct the activity, nor does it constitute permission to operate in the pharmacy premises, and it shall be considered void upon its expiration without the completion of the conditions and procedures specified in this decision.
In the event that all approvals from other concerned authorities are obtained, the final inspection procedures for the pharmacy premises are completed, and all fees prescribed by the Ministry of Health are paid, the license for the pharmacy shall be issued and it shall be permitted to conduct its activity.

Clause Three: Conditions and requirements necessary for renewing a private pharmacy license:

Submission of a letter requesting renewal for a period of four years, addressed to the Drug Inspection Department, through the pharmacy's account approved by the Department on the Ministry of Health's website, at least three months before the license expires.
2. Payment of the prescribed fees. If the application is submitted after the pharmacy's license expiration date, the prescribed fee shall be doubled. The private pharmacy license shall be canceled if a renewal application is not submitted within three months after the expiration date.
3. Signature authorization from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
4. A certificate from the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> proving that the license holder is not employed in the government sector.
5. The pharmacy license to be renewed.
6. The commercial license for the pharmacy issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, which must be valid.
7. The fire license for the pharmacy issued by the General Fire Force <orig>الإدارة العامة للإطفاء</orig>, which must be valid.
8. The most recent rent receipt for the pharmacy.
9. A certificate of safe transport and disposal issued by the competent authority at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, stating that a contract has been made with the company assigned to manage, operate, and maintain the medical waste treatment plant affiliated with the Ministry of Health.
10. Owners of pharmacies belonging to companies, individuals, and cooperative societies licensed to a non-Kuwaiti pharmacist, as well as private hospitals, must provide proof of appointing at least one Kuwaiti pharmacist in each private pharmacy.

## Clause Four: Requirements and regulations for obtaining a license to change the location of a private pharmacy:
1. Submission of a letter from the license holder requesting to change the pharmacy's location, addressed to the Drug Inspection Department, through the pharmacy's account approved by the Department on the Ministry of Health's website, to obtain approval from the Drug Inspection Department.
2. Submission of a photocopy of the license for the pharmacy whose location is to be changed.
3. Fulfillment of the requirements mentioned in Clause One of Article Two of this decision.

## Clause Five: Requirements and regulations for obtaining a license to change or modify the area of a private pharmacy:
1. Submission of a letter from the license holder requesting to modify the pharmacy's area, addressed to the Drug Inspection Department of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector at the Ministry of Health, through the pharmacy's account approved by the Department, specifying the type of change or modification requested.
2. A photocopy of the pharmacy license.
3. A valid lease agreement for the pharmacy.
4. The most recent rent receipt.
5. Signature authorization from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
6. A new sketch/floor plan.
7. The automated number of the establishment.
8. Written approval from the owner of the establishment for the change or modification in the pharmacy's area.
9. A certificate of safe transport and disposal issued by the competent authority at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, stating that a contract has been made with the company assigned to manage, operate, and maintain the medical waste treatment plant affiliated with the Ministry of Health.
10. Approval from the relevant government authorities for the request.

## Clause Six: Requirements and regulations for adding a storeroom to a private pharmacy license:
1. A letter from the pharmacy owner addressed to the Drug Inspection Department of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector at the Ministry of Health, through the pharmacy's account approved by the Department on the Ministry of Health's website, requesting an inspection to add a storeroom to the pharmacy license.
2. The storeroom must be connected or adjacent and have an entrance to the pharmacy.
3. A sketch/floor plan of the storeroom.
4. A photocopy of the pharmacy license.
5. A photocopy of the valid signature authorization issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
6. A lease agreement concluded between the pharmacy license holder (the applicant) and the owner of the premises.
7. The most recent rent receipt for the premises.
8. A certificate from the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> showing the automated number for the building and the unit.
9. A Celsius thermometer in the pharmacy storeroom, if any, with the temperature not to exceed 25 degrees Celsius.
10. A refrigerator for storing medicines, equipped with a Celsius thermometer, with the storage temperature maintained between 2 and 8 degrees Celsius.
11. Availability of air conditioning, ventilation, lighting, and shelves designed for storing medicines and medical products.
12. Medicines or medical products in storage must not be exposed to direct sunlight.
13. License from the General Fire Force <orig>الإدارة العامة للإطفاء</orig>.
14. Approval from the relevant government authorities for the request.

## Clause Seven: Requirements and regulations for obtaining approval for the temporary closure and preservation of a pharmacy license:

A letter from the pharmacy license holder addressed to the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, submitted through the pharmacy's account on the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> website as approved by the Department, specifying the date of reopening the pharmacy after the end of the temporary closure.
2. A photocopy of the pharmacy license.
3. A photocopy of the valid signature authorization issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
4. A photocopy of the valid commercial license for the pharmacy issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
5. A photocopy of the licenses of the pharmacists and pharmacy technicians working in the pharmacy.

Clause Nine: Requirements and controls for the permanent closure and cancellation of a pharmacy license:
1. A letter from the pharmacy license holder addressed to the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, submitted through the pharmacy's account on the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> website as approved by the Department, requesting the permanent closure and cancellation of the pharmacy license.
2. A photocopy of the pharmacy license.
3. A photocopy of the signature authorization issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
4. A photocopy of the license to practice the profession for the pharmacist who holds the pharmacy license.
5. A copy of the inspection report issued by the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> stating that the pharmacy is closed.
6. A photocopy of the licenses of the pharmacists and pharmacy technicians working in the pharmacy.

7. Submission of proof of implementation of the necessary requirements and controls for the liquidation of medicines and medical products belonging to the pharmacy, as referred to in Clause Eleven of Article Two of this decision.

Clause Ten: The license of a private pharmacy shall be canceled at the request of its owner or by a decision from the Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig> based on the recommendation of the competent authority in the following cases:
1. If the license is not utilized within one year from its date of issuance.
2. If the pharmacy is closed continuously for a period of six months without obtaining approval from the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
3. If the pharmacy is relocated from one place to another without prior approval from the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig>.
4. If a request to renew the pharmacy license is not submitted within three months after the expiry date of the license.
5. If the heirs of the license holder do not submit a request to transfer it to all or some of them within six months from the date of the license holder's death.
6. In the event the license holder leases it to a third party, has it invested by another, assigns it, or if it is proven that the pharmacy is managed by a person other than the licensee.

Clause Eleven: Requirements and controls for the liquidation of medicines and medical products belonging to the pharmacy in the case of temporary or permanent closure:
1. A letter from the pharmacy license holder requesting the closure of the pharmacy, addressed to the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, submitted through the pharmacy's account on the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> website as approved by the Department, attaching a statement that includes lists of all narcotic substances and preparations, psychotropic substances, and medicines subject to ministerial decisions, in addition to medicines and medical products not subject to them. The statement must include the names of these substances, their quantities, their batch numbers, and their expiration dates.
2. Submission of proof of returning the medicines and medical products to the supplying company licensed by the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, transferring them to another pharmacy, or destroying them in accordance with the regulations approved by the Ministry. The Department must be provided with proof thereof.
3. Submission of a request to the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> to sequester expired, unfit for use, damaged, or unwanted medicines, for the purpose of destroying them or returning them to the supplying company licensed by the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig>, while providing the Department with proof thereof.
4. In the case of the presence of psychotropic substances and preparations in the custody of the pharmacy, a request must be made to cancel the license to trade in these substances from the Narcotic Substances and Psychotropic Preparations Licensing Control Unit <orig>مراقبة تراخيص المواد والمستحضرات المخدرة والمؤثرات العقلية</orig>, and providing the Department

5. Contact the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> to cancel the accreditation of the pharmacy's drug registers subject to ministerial decisions.
6. Retain dispensed prescriptions for drugs subject to ministerial decisions for a period of six months from the date of dispensing. As for prescriptions for psychotropic substances, they must be retained for a period of three years from the date of dispensing, and five years for narcotic substances and preparations.
7. The holder of the pharmacy license requesting closure may relinquish custody of the drugs, pharmaceutical preparations, and other materials in the pharmacy's possession, provided that the receiving party is a pharmacy licensed by the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig>. A request must be submitted to the Department, including an attached list with the names of the materials, their quantities, batch numbers, and expiration dates, provided that the approval of the receiving pharmacy is obtained and the items are added to its inventory, following the approval of the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig>.
8. The holder of the pharmacy license shall submit a written undertaking assuming full responsibility for complying with all the aforementioned requirements and controls, and shall bear the legal consequences in case of violation of any of these requirements.

## Article Three
Requirements and controls that must be met for the storage of drugs, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetics, medical devices and supplies, and general hygiene in the pharmacy:

### Clause One: Storage Conditions:
1. The pharmacy temperature shall not exceed 25 degrees Celsius, and a Celsius thermometer must be provided and hung clearly and visibly in the location.
2. The temperature of the drug refrigerator shall be between 2 and 8 degrees Celsius, with a Celsius thermometer inside the refrigerator.
3. All drugs, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetics, or medical devices and supplies in the pharmacy must be displayed and stored on shelves or in cabinets raised at least 20 cm from the floor and at least 50 cm below the ceiling.
4. Do not store or display drugs, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetics, or medical devices and supplies in the pharmacy that belong to another pharmacy or entity.
5. Do not display expired or damaged drugs, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetics, or medical devices and supplies on the shelves designated for sale or store them in the drug refrigerator. They must be isolated from all other drugs, materials, and medical products stored in the pharmacy.
6. Do not store food or other non-pharmaceutical products in the drug refrigerator.
7. It is strictly forbidden to store any item in the pharmacy's restroom or in a storeroom not included in the pharmacy license, whether they are drugs, medical products, prescriptions, invoices, or bags.
8. Materials that decompose under the effect of light must be stored in opaque, light-proof bottles.
9. If there are flammable or hazardous materials in the pharmacy, they must be stored in the manner specified and approved by the General Fire Department <orig>الإدارة العامة للإطفاء</orig>.
10. The pharmacy premises shall not be used for any purpose other than the storage, display, sale, and dispensing of drugs, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetics, or medical devices and supplies, and only in their original packaging, provided that all the aforementioned materials have been issued a registration certificate and are authorized for circulation by the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs <orig>إدارة تسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية والنباتية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.

### Clause Two: General Hygiene Conditions:
1. No dust on the packages displayed or stored on the pharmacy's shelves and walls.
2. No dirt, paper waste, cardboard boxes, or empty cans on the floor.
3. Control of all types of insects and rodents.
4. Cleanliness of the restroom and facilities of the pharmacy.
5. No animals inside the pharmacy.

## Article Four
The holder of the pharmacy license and the pharmacists working therein shall be bound by the following:
1. The holder of the pharmacy license must notify the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> of the appointment of a manager for the pharmacy who holds a license to practice the pharmacy profession in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> for that same pharmacy. The manager may not manage more than one pharmacy. The pharmacy manager may, in his work and under his responsibility, be assisted by one or more pharmacists licensed to practice in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> at the same pharmacy. The manager shall be responsible for the workflow in the pharmacy and the custody of drugs, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetics, or medical devices and supplies therein, including the purchase invoices for these materials, the dispensed prescriptions, and the registers of drugs subject to the decisions
<page_end>22</page_end>

2. Recording all quantities of medications received by the pharmacy, their date of receipt, and their purchase invoice numbers in a special register approved by the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
3. Promptly recording medications dispensed by medical prescription, their quantities, and the numbers of the prescriptions they were dispensed against in the same special register approved by the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
4. No scraping, crossing out, erasing, or using correction fluid to alter the register's data. All data must be recorded with a non-erasable blue ink pen.
5. Filing medical prescriptions after stamping them and assigning them their own sequential numbers, ensuring they correspond to the entries in their special register approved by the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
6. Keeping and displaying the pharmacy license in a visible place within the pharmacy for which it was issued.
7. Retaining copies of previous inspection report forms in the pharmacy and providing them to the employees assigned for inspection upon their request.
8. Wearing a clean lab coat during official working hours in the pharmacy.
9. Displaying the pharmacy work ID, ensuring it is visible to the public and clearly inscribed in both Arabic and English with the name, Civil ID number, license number, profession, and the name of the pharmacy for which the pharmacist or pharmacy technician is licensed.
10. Keeping purchase invoices within the pharmacy, issued by supplying companies licensed by the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> and legally authorized to import these products into the country, in a special file for reference when necessary, in accordance with the relevant ministerial resolutions. Purchasing from intermediaries is not permitted.
11. Retaining photocopies of registration certificates issued by the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> for all medications, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetic materials and preparations, or medical devices and supplies present in the pharmacy, ensuring they are available to the inspection committees of the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> upon request.
12. Adhering during sale to the pricing set by the Ministry for medications, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetic materials and preparations, or medical devices and supplies for which such a decision has been issued.
13. Recording the prices of all medications, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetic materials and preparations, or medical devices and supplies displayed and intended for sale in Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> on a sticker placed on their original external packaging, in a clear manner, including the pharmacy's name.
14. Using the Arabic or English language in issuing pharmacy invoices for all its transactions, which must include:
    - a. The pharmacy's name, address, phone number, and the invoice date.
    - b. The product's name, specifications, and expiration date.
    - c. The quantity or number of units sold, specifying the unit of sale.
    - d. The product's batch number.
    - e. The price in Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
    - f. The name and signature of the responsible pharmacist.
    - g. The pharmacy's stamp, including the date of dispensing.

## Article Five:
Requirements and regulations for the mechanism of organizing attendance, departure, and leave for pharmacists and pharmacy technicians working in private pharmacies:

### First Clause: Mechanism for organizing attendance and departure, which shall be in one of the following ways:
1. Providing a physical logbook and keeping it in the pharmacy, with adherence to the following:
    - a. It must contain the names of the pharmacists and pharmacy technicians working in the pharmacy.
    - b. The logbook pages must be divided into months and days.
    - c. Signing at the beginning and end of each workday or on-call shift.
    - d. The start and end of leave must be specified in the logbook, and the employee is exempt from signing during it, provided that the leave is approved by the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
    - e. No scraping, crossing out, erasing, or using correction fluid to alter the logbook's data. All data must be recorded with a non-erasable blue ink pen.
2. An electronic record to prove attendance and departure by fingerprint, with adherence to the following:
    - a. Enabling employees assigned for inspection to access the electronic attendance record, as well as enabling them to obtain an electronic or printed copy of the record for any time period whenever requested.
    - b. Enabling pharmacists and pharmacy technicians working in the pharmacy to obtain

T. In the event of an electronic system failure for any reason, a transition to a paper-based register shall be made until the electronic system is restored to operation.

Clause Two: In the event a pharmacist takes leave, the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> must be notified at least one week prior to the leave. In this case, the pharmacy license holder must close the pharmacy until the pharmacist returns from leave, unless another pharmacist, approved by the Department, is appointed to replace them during the leave, provided that the leave period does not exceed three months.

Clause Three: If a pharmacist leaves the pharmacy where they are employed, both the pharmacist and the pharmacy license holder must immediately notify the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> by submitting a letter within a period not exceeding one week from the date of leaving employment. In this case, the pharmacy license holder must close the pharmacy until another pharmacist, licensed to practice the pharmacy profession in Kuwait, is appointed to be responsible for it. The license holder must notify the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department of the new pharmacist's name, and the new pharmacist may not commence work in the pharmacy until approval is granted by the Department and other concerned authorities through an official letter.

## Article Six
Requirements and regulations that must be met to operate on a night shift system:

Clause One: Private pharmacies wishing to operate on a night shift system must submit the following documents:
1. A request letter from the pharmacy license holder addressed to the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, submitted through the pharmacy's account approved by the Department on the Ministry of Health's website, to open the pharmacy 24 hours.
2. A photocopy of the pharmacy license.
3. A photocopy of the commercial license for the pharmacy issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
4. A photocopy of the signature authorization from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
5. A needs assessment letter from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
6. A photocopy of the licenses of the pharmacists and pharmacy technicians working in the pharmacy, provided that the number is not less than three pharmacists in addition to the license holder.
7. A photocopy of the license to practice the profession for the Kuwaiti pharmacist who is the pharmacy license holder.

Clause Two: Obtain approval from the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> before commencing the service.

## Article Seven
Requirements and regulations that must be met when dispensing medical prescriptions, medicines, and medical products:

Clause One: The pharmacist must verify the following:
1- The medical prescription must contain the following information before being dispensed:
    a. Name of the health facility that issued the medical prescription.
    b. The patient's full name (first, middle, and last).
    c. The patient's identification number (Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig> or passport for visitors).
    d. The patient's gender.
    e. The patient's file number.
    f. The patient's age or date of birth.
    g. The patient's weight for children under 12 years of age and for medications whose dosages are calculated based on weight.
    h. The date the medical prescription was written.
    i. The name, specialty, and professional level of the treating physician, their place of work, signature, and stamp.
    j. The generic name of the drug, its strength, and its dosage form. (Generic Name, Dosage form, Strength)
    k. The dosage, frequency of administration, duration of treatment, and route of administration. (Frequency, Duration, Route of Dose Administration)
2- Verify the patient's information on the prescription before handing over the medication.
3- Ensure the medical prescription is free from contraindications and medication errors.
4- Dispense medical prescriptions issued by physicians licensed by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> after all conditions have been met.
5- Provide the Pharmaceutical Inspection Department of the Pharmaceutical Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> with a periodic report every three months detailing the prescriptions dispensed.
6- The pharmacist has the right to withhold or refuse to dispense a medical prescription if it does not meet the conditions or contain the information specified in the first clause of this article.

Clause Two: Medicines and Medical Products:
1- License holders, pharmacy managers, pharmacists, and pharmacy technicians working therein are prohibited from handling, dispensing, or selling medicines, health products, food supplements, herbal preparations, or special foods if their expiration date is less than thirty days away. With regard to medicines for chronic diseases and other preparations and food supplements dispensed for medical treatment, the duration of treatment must be calculated up to the last dose, ensuring that the remaining validity period of the said medicines and products is not less than thirty days.

2- The expiry date recorded on all medicines, health products, food supplements, herbal preparations, or cosmetic materials and preparations, if written in the format of only a month and year, shall be considered to expire on the last day of that same month.
3- It is prohibited to accept or return medicines, health products, food supplements, herbal preparations, or special foods after they have been dispensed or sold to the public in private pharmacies.
4- It is not permissible to display, sell, trade, or store medicines, health products, food supplements, or herbal preparations unless their expiry date and batch number are written on their packaging. The period of validity after opening the package must also be written on the packaging of cosmetic materials and preparations.
5- Every medicine, health product, food supplement, special food, herbal preparation, cosmetic preparation, or medical device and supply displayed or sold in a pharmacy must be in its original packaging, approved for circulation by the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs, which is part of the Drug Control Sector.
6- The expiry date of free samples of medicines and medical products circulated between supplying companies, doctors, and pharmacists shall not be less than sixty days.

## Article Eight
Requirements and controls for the mechanism of placing labels on the original packaging of a pharmaceutical product:
1. An identification label shall be affixed to the outer packaging of each medicine package dispensed from the pharmacy, printed with the following information:
    a. Patient's name in Arabic or English.
    b. Date the medicine was dispensed.
    c. Name and phone number of the dispensing pharmacy.
    d. Name, concentration, and pharmaceutical form of the medicine.
    e. Instructions for use of the medicine (dosage - frequency - duration of treatment - method of administration) as stated in the prescription.
    f. Quantity of medicine dispensed.
    g. Expiry date of the medicine.
    h. Batch number.
    i. Instructions for storing the medicine.
2. The expiry date, batch number, and storage instructions may be omitted from the medicine's identification label if this information is visible on the original dispensed medicine package and not obscured by any label.
3. Any additional warnings or instructions for the patient regarding medicines that require them shall be added to the medicine's identification label, ensuring they are phrased in simple, easy-to-understand terms.
4. The medicine's identification label shall be written in a language understandable to the patient or their caregiver.
5. When the medicine's identification label is written by hand – when necessary – it must contain the information mentioned in item 1 of this Article and be written with a non-erasable blue ink pen, in clear and legible handwriting, and without abbreviations.
6. The medicine's identification label shall be affixed to the medicine package in a suitable place so that it does not obscure the important information on the manufacturer's packaging, which is:
    a. Name and concentration of the medicine.
    b. Expiry date of the medicine.
    c. Batch number.

## Article Nine
Requirements and controls necessary to obtain approval for delivery service:
First Clause: Pharmacies are permitted to deliver medicines, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetic materials and preparations, or medical devices and supplies subject to the Drug Control Sector after submitting a request to the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> and obtaining approval upon meeting the following requirements:
1. The pharmacy's license must be valid.
2. The number designated for delivery requests must belong to the pharmacy and not be used for another pharmacy.
3. The vehicle designated for transport must belong to the private pharmacy. If the pharmacy uses a delivery company, the contract concluded between them must be submitted, and this company must be licensed for delivery activities by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
4. The temperature in the containers designated for transporting and storing the materials referred to in this Article must comply with what is approved by the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
5. The vehicles designated for transport must be equipped with a device for measuring and recording the internal temperature, as well as a cold box.
6. Medicines, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, or cosmetic materials and preparations intended for delivery by the pharmacy must be kept in tightly sealed bags.
7. The Drug Inspection Department shall be responsible for verifying compliance of the vehicles designated for transport belonging to private pharmacies with the conditions mentioned in this Article.

8. The sales invoice must be issued by the pharmacy and indicate that it is for a delivery service.
9. The sales invoice must be delivered to the requesting party upon delivery of the order.
10. The pharmacy must maintain a special register for all medicines, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetic materials and preparations, or medical devices and supplies upon delivery of orders. This register must state the product name, the name of the requesting person, their full address, phone number, and must include their Civil ID number.
11. Adherence to the selling prices of medicines, health products, food supplements, special foods, herbal preparations, cosmetic materials and preparations, or medical devices and supplies subject to the pricing set by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
12. Pharmacies are prohibited from delivering the materials referred to in this Article that are dispensed by prescription, in accordance with the ministerial resolutions regulating them.
Clause Two: The Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Drug Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> reserves the right to cancel the delivery service approval issued to the pharmacy in the event of a violation of the provisions of Article Nine referred to in this resolution, without recourse to the pharmacy.

## Article Ten
Requirements and Controls for External Advertisements (Facade) of Private Pharmacies:
Clause One: Any identifying advertisement on the facades of private pharmacies requiring a license is considered an external advertisement. This includes advertising the trade name, logo, color, or content used by pharmacy license holders. The advertisement also includes any material or content, in any form or type, intended to promote the name or commercial activity of the pharmacies.
Clause Two: The mechanism for external advertisements (facade) for private pharmacies is regulated such that approval must be issued by the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Drug Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> before the necessary licenses are issued by the competent government authorities, as follows:
1. Obtain approval before displaying the external advertisement on the pharmacy's facade.
2. Do not use compound trade names with similar content, or repeat the same content or form of external advertisement for more than one pharmacy.
3. Do not add or remove any word, symbol, logo, or number, whether before or after the advertised name.
4. The trade name advertised in the external advertisement must match the name mentioned in the private pharmacy license issued by the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Drug Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
5. The pharmacy's name must be written on the external advertisement in clear Arabic letters. The name may be added in English, provided it matches the name mentioned in Arabic.
6. The content or form of the external advertisement may not be changed, modified, added to, or deleted after obtaining approval from the Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Drug Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
7. The advertisement may not be used if the pharmacy's license is canceled.
Clause Three: Holders of private pharmacy licenses are required to add the pharmacy logo (attached to this resolution) as an indicative and identifying symbol for private pharmacies in the State of Kuwait.
Clause Four: The Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Drug Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية</orig> at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> must coordinate and follow up with other competent government authorities in this regard, and monitor all external advertisements to ensure they meet the requirements specified in this resolution.

## Article Eleven
Without prejudice to any more severe penalty stipulated in other laws, the provisions on crimes, penalties, and administrative sanctions contained in the provisions of Articles 14 and 15 of Law No. 28 of 1996 concerning the Regulation of the Pharmacy Profession and the Circulation of Medicines, and the provisions of Law No. 70 of 2020 concerning the Practice of the Medical Profession and its Ancillary Professions, Patients' Rights, and Health Facilities, shall apply to any violator of the provisions of this resolution.

## Article Twelve
Ministerial Resolutions Nos. (4/2012, 264/2018, 19/2019, 170/2019, 256/2019, 260/2019, 225/2023) are hereby repealed.

## Article Thirteen
This resolution shall be communicated to whom it may concern for its implementation, shall be effective from the date of its issuance, and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

- And upon the provisions of Law No. 28 of 1996 concerning the regulation of the pharmacy profession and the circulation of medicines, as amended by Law No. 30 of 2016, and their executive regulations.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. 237 of 2025 concerning the regulations and procedures for licensing pharmacies in the private sector and the circulation of medicines and medical products therein.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. 109 of 2020 concerning the display, sale, and circulation of medicines and pharmaceutical preparations accompanying this resolution in the main markets of cooperative societies and central markets only.
- And based on the requirements of the public interest and the submission of the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>.

## It is decided
### Article One
The display and sale of medicines and medical products listed in the table attached to this resolution (Annex No. 1) (Appendix I) are permitted through non-fixed points of sale or e-marketing websites licensed by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, or cooperative societies, central markets, or retail food stores.

### Article Two
The medicines and medical products must be registered with the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> and supplied by local companies that are suppliers approved by the Ministry.

### Article Three
The display and sale of medicines and medical products are permitted only in the concentrations and pharmaceutical forms mentioned in the table attached to this resolution (Annex No. 1) (Appendix I).

### Article Four
The medicines and medical products must be in their original packaging and containers from the manufacturer, as approved by the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs <orig>إدارة تسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية والنباتية</orig>.
