2- The absence of dirt or dust on the packages displayed on the shelves.
3- Storing them away from sunlight and moisture.
4- Medicines and medical products must be displayed in a manner that ensures their protection and keeps them out of the reach of children.
5- Not displaying or selling damaged medicines or medical products.
6- Not displaying or selling expired medicines or medical products.
7- The validity period of the displayed product must not be less than four months.

## Article Six

The places of sale mentioned in the first article of this decision are required to submit an application via the email of the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs <orig>إدارة تسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية والنباتية</orig>, attaching a list of the medicines and medical products intended for display and sale in accordance with what is stated in the table attached to this decision (Appendix No. 1) (Appendix I) to obtain an approval permit from the Department, which must include the following data:
1- The trade name of the product.
2- The product registration certificate.
3- The appearance of the outer packaging.

## Article Seven

The Drug Inspection Department <orig>إدارة تفتيش الأدوية</orig> of the Drug and Food Control Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة الدوائية والغذائية</orig> shall undertake the task of implementing the provisions of this decision in accordance with the powers vested in them and in accordance with the provisions of the aforementioned Law No. 28 of 1996 and its amendments.

## Article Eight

Ministerial Decision No. 109 of 2020 concerning the display, sale, and circulation of medicines and pharmaceutical preparations accompanying this decision in the main markets of cooperative societies and central markets only, is hereby repealed.

## Article Nine

This decision shall be communicated to whom it may concern for its implementation, shall be effective from its date of issuance, and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

- And based on the provisions of Law No. 28 of 1996 concerning the regulation of the pharmacy profession and the circulation of medicines, as amended by Law No. 30 of 2016, and their executive regulations.
- And based on the provisions of Law No. 70 of 2020 regarding the practice of the medical profession and its auxiliary professions, and the rights of patients and health facilities.
- And based on Ministerial Resolution No. 237 of 2025 concerning the regulations and procedures for licensing pharmacies in the private sector and the circulation of medicines and medical products therein.
- And based on Ministerial Resolution No. 238 of 2025 concerning the display and sale of medicines or medical products through non-fixed points of sale, e-commerce websites, cooperative societies, central markets, or retail food stores.
- And based on the requirements of the interest of the work, and what was presented to us by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>.

**- Has Decided -**

### Article One
Private pharmacies are authorized to display and sell the medicines or medical products listed in the appendix to Ministerial Resolution No. 238 of 2025 through vending machines at non-fixed points of sale, in accordance with the requirements and conditions stipulated in this resolution.

### Article Two
The applicant, who is the holder of the pharmacy license, must, in order to obtain approval for the sale of medicines or medical products through vending machines at non-fixed points of sale, submit the application via the email of the Private Sector Inspection Section of the Drug Inspection Department, which is part of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, Drugia-private@moh.gov.kw, attaching photocopies of the following requirements:
1. A letter requesting an inspection of the vending machine.
2. A valid pharmacy license.
3. The applicant's Civil ID card.
4. The license to practice the pharmacy profession for the pharmacist or pharmacy technician responsible for the vending machine.
5. The phone number of the pharmacy and of the person responsible for the vending machines.
6. A lease agreement concluded between the applicant and the site owner, including the owner's approval of the sales activity, specifying the site address and the location of the point of sale.
7. A purchase invoice proving that the applicant, the pharmacy license holder, is the owner of the vending machines, or the submission of a lease contract and receipt from the entity that owns the machines.
8. The pharmacy's medicine delivery permit issued by the Drug Inspection Department of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
9. A photo of the identifying sign displayed on the front of the vending machines.
10. An approval permit issued by the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs, part of the Drug Control Sector at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, for the list of medicines and medical products to be displayed and sold.
11. Approvals from other government entities, if required.

### Article Three
The necessary conditions for obtaining approval to display and sell medicines and medical products through vending machines at non-fixed points of sale are as follows:
1- The pharmacy license must be issued by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> and be valid.
2- All medicines and medical products displayed or sold through vending machines must be on the list attached to Ministerial Resolution No. 238 of 2025, be registered with the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>, have a circulation permit, and be supplied by local companies that are approved suppliers for the Ministry.
3- The identifying sign on the front of the vending machines must display the name of the applicant's pharmacy. The text must be in Arabic, and English may be added provided it is identical to the Arabic. It must be clear to the public and match the pharmacy name written on the license issued by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>. No word, symbol, logo, or number may be added before or after the licensed name, and the pharmacy's phone number must be displayed on it.
4- The vending machines must be owned by the applicant, the pharmacy license holder, or proof of their lease from another party must be provided.
5- The temperature of the location where the vending machines are placed must not exceed 25 degrees Celsius.
6- There must be no dust or dirt on the packages displayed on the shelves inside the vending machines.
7- No damaged or expired medicines or medical products may be displayed or sold, and the remaining shelf life of the displayed product must not be less than four months.
8- Adherence to the pricing set by the Ministry is required when displaying or selling priced medicines or medical products.
9- The distance between the vending machine for which approval is sought and the nearest

## Second: Poultry and Ostrich Companies and Farms
### Mechanism for Disbursing Subsidized Feed:
1- Submit the purchase invoice if the purchase is local, or the veterinary health release statement in case of import from abroad, to the Poultry Diseases Section of the Animal Health Department, along with a statement clarifying the type, number, and housing location.
2- If the Poultry Diseases Section approves from a health standpoint, it will stamp the invoice or the veterinary health release statement and send it to the Poultry Section of the Animal Production Department.
3- The Poultry Section will conduct a field visit to the farm (housing location) to inspect the shipment (chicks) and verify it against the purchase invoice. It will then submit a report to the Animal Support Section of the Animal Production Department and the Poultry Diseases Section, detailing the number, age, and type for approval and entry into the computer registry.
    a- If the broiler chicken shipment arrives before the 15th of the month, the entitled amount of feed will be disbursed in the same month.
    b- If the broiler chicken shipment arrives after the 15th of the month, the entitled amount of feed will be disbursed in the following month.
    c- If the laying hen shipment arrives during any month, the feed amount will be disbursed from the date of the shipment's arrival, starting from the third month.
4- The company or farm must submit the purchase invoice or the veterinary health release statement within one week from the date of the shipment's (chicks') arrival. Invoices submitted after this one-week period from the shipment's arrival date will not be considered.
5- The Animal Support Section will send a monthly statement to the Kuwait Flour Mills & Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig> listing the names of companies and poultry farms eligible for feed support, detailing their feed allocations.
6- If any company or farm submits invoices to obtain subsidized feed and it is proven that the shipment (chicks) does not match the purchase invoice, or that the chicks are not present upon the field visit by the Poultry Section or the Poultry Diseases Section, the following measures will be taken:
    a- The support for this company or farm will be suspended for a period of (6 months) for the first offense.
    b- If this is repeated, the support will be suspended for a full year from the date of the occurrence.
    c- In case of continued violation, the Authority has the right to take the necessary action against the violating company or farm.
7- Subsidized feed for laying hens, broilers, and breeders is disbursed as follows:

### First: Laying Hens and Breeders: Subsidized feed is disbursed as follows:
a- Rearing Period Stage: This period lasts for 20 weeks, during which corn and grower feed will be disbursed as follows:
The grower feed for the 20 weeks will be disbursed in a single payment with the first disbursement for the shipment (chicks).
b- Production Period Stage: During this stage, feed allocations of corn for laying hens and breeders will be disbursed monthly from the date of the shipment's (chicks') arrival up to (80) weeks of age. After this age, the farm is not entitled to any subsidized feed.

### Second: Broiler Chickens: The allocated quantities of feed for broiler chickens are disbursed in a single payment during the rearing period, which lasts for (40) days.
8- The feed material may not be substituted for another, except in the case that the required feed material is out of stock, in which case it may be substituted only with a feed material from the types of ready-mixed compound feeds.

## Third: Companies and Farms Producing Fresh Milk (Dairy Cattle):
1- The Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig> Animal Production Center, under the Livestock Department, will conduct field visits to farms to submit a report detailing the number and categories of the herd (milking cows, dry pregnant cows, bulls, heifers, suckling calves) for each farm.
2- The Animal Support Section will calculate the quantities allocated to each farm according to the designated feed allocation schedule.
3- The Animal Support Section will send a statement every (3 months) to the Kuwait Flour Mills & Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig>, detailing the quantities and types of feed to be disbursed to each company or farm.
4- Substitution of feed types is permitted according to the preference of the dairy cattle breeding companies and farms, provided that the allocated quantity of feed and the funds designated for it are not exceeded. This is subject to the Authority's approval, with the substitution occurring once every three months, a maximum of 15 days before the calculation of the quarterly feed allocations and prior to sending the statements to the Kuwait Flour Mills & Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig>.
5- Subsidized feed will be disbursed to farms and companies that import cattle for production purposes as soon as the shipment (imported cattle) arrives.

6- Companies and farms that raise cows and calves and do not supply fresh milk to companies and dairy factories accredited by the Authority shall be treated as hobbyist cow breeders when subsidized feed is disbursed to them.
7- Subsidized feed shall be disbursed to holders of agricultural holdings designated for cow breeding and agricultural holdings that have an auxiliary animal production license (cow breeding), provided they meet the technical and health conditions and are not in violation, according to the approved feed allocation statement.

## Article Three
**General Rules:**
- 1- The subsidized feed allocations for cow and poultry companies and farms may be divided according to their needs during the month, and they shall not have the right to claim it later if it is not withdrawn during the same month.
2- The subsidized feed allocations for livestock breeders (sheep – camels – cows) may not be divided; the entire quantity must be withdrawn at once during the same month.
3- The approved statements from the competent authority shall be sent to the Flour Mills Company, indicating the quantities and types of feed due to be disbursed to companies and farms (cows – poultry – ostriches).
4- The electronic chips shall not be transferred to the name of the breeder (buyer) during the month in which the subsidy is due to be disbursed in the name of the breeder (seller). They may be transferred during the following month, and the vaccination certificate and feed card shall be issued to the breeder in the name of the breeder (buyer).
5- The quantity that was allocated on the feed card issued in the name of the breeder (seller) shall be amended as of the transfer of the chip, and the subsidy shall be disbursed according to the number of animals allocated to him.
6- The competent authority at the Authority has the right to conduct periodic inspections of the number of animals at any time as determined by the competent department, prepare a report on any violations found, and submit it to the Board to take appropriate action.

## Article Four
Subsidized animal feed shall be disbursed by virtue of an automated disbursement permit issued by the Authority, indicating the types and quantities of feed materials due under the feed card during the month. A statement of the quantities delivered to the breeders from the warehouses of the Kuwait Flour Mills and Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig> shall be sent via the automated network system linked between the Authority and the Company for each financial claim submitted by them to disburse the value of the due subsidy, after being signed by the concerned entity for authentication of the claim.

## Article Five
The value of the subsidy shall be disbursed within the limits of the amount approved by the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> and allocated for feed support in the Authority's budget for the fiscal year 2025-2026.

## Article Six
The concerned party must comply with all laws and regulations issued by the Authority, as well as the health and technical conditions and decisions regulating the practice of the activity. The disbursement of the subsidy to violating breeders (sheep – camels – hobbyist cows) shall be suspended from the date the concerned party is notified of the violation by the competent authority at the Authority for the months of violation. Disbursement shall resume starting from the month following the removal of the violation, as the feed card for the breeder or their representative will be suspended on the automated system.

## Article Seven
The feed card shall be suspended for a period of not less than 3 months for the breeder or their representative in the event of an assault on an employee during the performance of their job duties, while preserving the employee's right to recourse against the breeder.

## Article Eight
The concerned party is obligated to preserve the subsidized materials and use them in the manner specified by the Authority and Law No. (117) of 2013 concerning the supervision of trade in goods, services, and crafts and the setting of prices, and not to offer them for sale or resell them.

## Article Nine
For holders of plots or agricultural holdings, it is required to provide proof of payment of the annual rental value of the plot due to the Authority for the last year before the end of the fiscal year. In case of non-payment, the disbursement of subsidized feed allocations shall be suspended.

## Article Ten
The subsidy shall not be disbursed until after the deduction of any dues owed to the Authority, whether they are fees, financial fines, enforceable judicial rulings, or otherwise, as well as dues to any government entity by virtue of a judicial ruling against the concerned party.

## Article Eleven
In the event of price adjustments and increases according to developments in global feed prices by the Kuwait Flour Mills and Bakeries Company <orig>شركة مطاحن الدقيق والمخابز الكويتية</orig>, the breeder shall bear the increase in price differences.

## Article Twelve
The subsidy categories shall be adjusted according to developments in global feed prices and shall be within the limits of the approved budget for the fiscal year 2025-2026.

## Article Thirteen
The competent sector is obligated to determine the quantities of subsidized feed allocations in accordance with the applicable regulations and organizing decisions, and the competent authorities shall be notified thereof.

## Article Fourteen
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this decision, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>

Issued on: 8 September 2025

- And upon the decision of the Authority's Board of Directors No. (93/3/2025) issued in session No. (3) held on 8/7/2025 and approved by His Excellency the Minister regarding the approval of the decision to disburse support for locally born and raised heifers for the fiscal year 2025/2026.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (31) of 2025 issued on 04/03/2025 regarding the assignment of Mr. Engineer / Salem Hay Al-Hay <orig>سالم حاي الحاي</orig> (Director of the Marine Control Department), in addition to his work, to carry out the duties of the Director General of the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
- And upon the budget of the Public Authority for the fiscal year 2025/2026.
- And based on the interest and requirements of the work.

## Article One
Support shall be disbursed for locally born and raised heifers to the owners of holdings designated for cattle breeding in the Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig> area and agricultural holdings that have an auxiliary animal production license (cattle breeding), which meet the technical and health conditions and supply raw milk to approved local Kuwaiti dairy companies, according to the regulations in force by the Authority, in cash, in a total amount of 150 K.D. (one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) per head, to be disbursed in two installments as follows:
- The first installment of 60 Dinars shall be disbursed when the heifer reaches the age of (9 months).
- The second installment of 90 Dinars shall be disbursed when the heifer reaches the age of (18 months).

## Article Two
The breeder must notify the Authority of every female heifer within three months of its birth to ensure it remains in the herd, so that the Authority's affiliated center can, in turn, carry out the process of tagging the new heifers and entering them into the support records. In the event that the heifer's support tag number is lost, a replacement number shall be issued, and the Animal Health Department <orig>إدارة الصحة الحيوانية</orig> shall be notified to monitor its health and install its electronic chip. In case of failure to report within the aforementioned period, the breeder is not entitled to claim any dues related to the support or any other compensation.

## Article Three
Support shall not be granted for heifers that die at an age of less than 4 months. In the event of the death of heifers aged (4 months) and above, the government veterinarian shall submit a report to the Authority's affiliated center to take the necessary action regarding the calculation of the value of

## Article Four
The disbursement of support shall be within the limits of the amount allocated in the Authority's budget for the fiscal year 2025/2026, and the disbursement shall be in cash.

## Article Five
The concerned party must comply with all laws and regulations issued by the Authority, the health and technical conditions, the resolutions regulating the practice of the activity, and the procedures stipulated in Resolution No. (162/2002) concerning penal measures for violators of the heifer support decision and any amendments that may be made to it. The disbursement of support shall be suspended in case of a violation, and it is not permissible to disburse the suspended amounts during the violation period or to claim entitlement to them. The disbursement of support shall resume for the next installment after the violation is rectified.

## Article Six
Support shall not be disbursed until after the deduction of any dues owed to the Authority, whether they are fees, fines, enforceable judicial rulings, or otherwise, as well as dues owed to any government entity by virtue of a judicial ruling against the concerned party.

## Article Seven
Any of the veterinary clinics affiliated with the Authority must be notified in the event of the sale of any of the cattle herd in order to monitor the animal's health and track its location. Whoever violates this shall be subject to the aforementioned Resolution (162/2002) and any amendments that may be made to it.

## Article Eight
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this resolution. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

- And upon the decision of the Authority's Board of Directors No. (95/3/2025) issued in session No. (3) held on 8/7/2025 and approved by His Excellency the Minister regarding the approval of the decision to disburse fresh milk subsidies for the fiscal year 2025/2026.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (31) of 2025 issued on 04/03/2025 regarding the assignment of Mr. Engineer / Salem Hay Al-Hay <orig>سالم حاي الحاي</orig> (Director of the Marine Control Department), in addition to his current duties, to carry out the responsibilities of the Director General of the Public Authority for Agriculture and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>.
- And upon the budget of the Public Authority for Agriculture and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> for the fiscal year 2025/2026.
- And based on the interest and requirements of the work.

## Article One
- Fresh milk subsidies shall be granted to holdings designated for cattle breeding in the Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig> area and agricultural holdings that have an auxiliary animal production license (cattle breeding), which meet the technical and health conditions and supply raw milk to approved local Kuwaiti dairy companies and factories, in accordance with the regulations in force by the Authority.

## Article Two
- A financial subsidy of (80) fils (eighty fils) shall be disbursed to holdings designated for cattle breeding and agricultural holdings that have an auxiliary animal production license (cattle breeding) for each liter of fresh milk produced by the holding and delivered to Kuwaiti dairy manufacturing companies and factories, provided that it conforms to the Kuwaiti standard specifications for good and clean raw milk.

## Article Three
- The Authority shall consider applications submitted by owners of affected holdings regarding the disbursement of the subsidy for their inability to supply milk for reasons beyond their control, in accordance with a report approved by the competent department within the Authority, and the Authority's decision in this regard shall be final.

## Article Four
- Disbursement shall be within the limits of the approved amount allocated for fresh milk subsidies in the Authority's budget for the fiscal year (2025/2026).

## Article Five
- For holders of plots or agricultural holdings, it is required to provide proof of payment of the annual rent for the plot due to the Authority for the last year before the end of the fiscal year.

## Article Six
- The subsidy shall not be disbursed until all dues to the Authority are paid, whether they are fees, fines, enforceable judicial rulings, or otherwise, as well as any dues to any government entity by virtue of a judicial ruling against the concerned party.

## Article Seven
- The concerned party must comply with all laws and regulations issued by the Authority, as well as the health and technical conditions and decisions regulating the practice of the activity. The disbursement of the subsidy shall be suspended if a violation is proven, and it is not permissible to disburse the suspended amounts during the violation period or to claim their entitlement. The disbursement of the subsidy shall be resumed from the following month after the violation is rectified.

## Article Eight
- All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this decision, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>

- The violation report submitted by the Closed Areas Department No. (324), issued on 09/09/2025, stating that the user of Plot (633) committed the following violations:
– Encroachment outside the plot boundaries by an area of 80 meters.
- And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
And in the public interest.

**It is decided**
**(Article One)**
To close Plot No. (633) located in the South Amghara area – Block (1), until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.

**(Article Two)**

  - Engaging in blacksmithing activities without an industrial license over an area of 200 m2.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (503/2025/9) held on 22/5/2025.
- And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
And in the public interest.

**It is decided**
**(Article One)**
To close shops No. (25-26) in Plot No. (57) – located in the East Ahmadi <orig>شرق الأحمدي</orig> area, Block (8) – belonging to M/s Kuwait Innovation Center for Electrical and Electronic Appliances <orig>مركز الكويت للابتكار لأجهزة الكهربائية والإلكترونية</orig> – until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.

**(Article Two)**
In the event the violation is not removed after the passing of one (month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

**(Article Three)**
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its own jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry

Issued on: 5 October 2025

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (178) of 2025
### Regarding the license application submitted by Goldman Sachs International to practice securities activities

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments;
- Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the promotion of direct investment in the State of Kuwait, and its executive regulations and their amendments;
- And the Investment License Certificate No. 105/2025 issued by the Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>;
- And the application for a license for securities activities – foreign company branch, submitted by Goldman Sachs International;
- And based on Resolution No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**The following has been decided:**
**Article One:**
The branch of Goldman Sachs International is licensed, in accordance with this Article, to practice the following activities:
1. Investment Advisor activity.
2. Underwriting Agent activity.

**Article Two:**
The license term for the aforementioned branch of Goldman Sachs International shall be three years, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate, after payment of the prescribed fee.
The aforementioned branch of Goldman Sachs International is obligated to pay the prescribed fee upon renewal of the license for any other period in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 7 of 2010, its executive regulations and their amendments, and the resolutions and instructions of the Authority.

**Article Three:**

Head of the Supervision Sector

The Ministry of Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الإسلامية</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. 7-2025/2026 in accordance with the following conditions and details:

<table_caption>Tender Details for Ministry of Islamic Affairs Practice No. 7-2025/2026</table_caption>
<table>
| Subject of the Practice | Requesting Authority | Practice Fee | Closing Date | Date and Location for Opening of Envelopes |
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
| Supply, installation, and technical support for network devices, servers, and their accessories | Ministry of Islamic Affairs | 75 K.D. | 30/10/2025 | 1:00 PM on Sunday, 02/11/2025, at the meeting hall attached to the office of the Assistant Undersecretary for Administrative and Financial Affairs <orig>وكيل الوزارة المساعد للشؤون الإدارية والمالية</orig> - 6th Floor |

- Practice documents can be obtained starting from Sunday, 12/10/2025, and on the following days during official working hours from the Tenders Section at the Financial Affairs Department – Sixth Floor, at the Ministry's headquarters building located in the Al-Raq'i <orig>الرقعي</orig> area.
- The deadline for submitting any reservations or inquiries regarding the aforementioned practice is 23/10/2025. No requests will be considered after this date.
- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 30/10/2025. Bids received after this deadline will not be considered.

- The preliminary guarantee must be submitted in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee approved by a local bank in the State of Kuwait. The submitted guarantee must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity (90 days).
- Any bid not accompanied by a preliminary guarantee covering the required amount or the bid's validity period will be disqualified.

- The exam consists of four subjects, and the applicant must pass all prescribed subjects to obtain a certificate of passing the exam for practicing the profession of account auditing <orig>مزاولة مهنة مراقبة الحسابات</orig>.
- In the event that the applicant passes some exam subjects but not others, they may retain the results of the subjects they passed, subject to the following conditions:
  a. To pass all subjects, the applicant must achieve a score of no less than 65% of the total grade for each exam.
  b. The number of subjects passed by the applicant in the first attempt must not be less than two.
  c. The applicant must apply for a maximum of two upcoming sessions, other than the current session, within a period not exceeding three (3) calendar years from the date of passing the minimum number of subjects.
  d. The applicant's right to retain the passed subjects shall be forfeited if conditions (b) and (c) are not met.
- The applicant is permitted to request cancellation of the exam up to a maximum of one week before the date of the first exam for practicing the profession of account auditing <orig>مزاولة مهنة مراقبة الحسابات</orig>. The applicant is not entitled to a refund of the fees after the application submission period has ended, except in cases of death.
- The exam results will be announced after the final grades have been recorded by the Committee for Organizing the Rules and Procedures of the Exam for Practicing the Profession of Account Auditing <orig>لجنة تنظيم قواعد وإجراءات اختبار مزاولة مهنة مراقبة الحسابات</orig>.
- The applicant has the right to appeal the exam result by submitting an official letter addressed to the Chairman of the Committee for Organizing the Rules and Procedures of the Exam for Practicing the Profession of Account Auditing <orig>لجنة تنظيم قواعد وإجراءات اختبار مزاولة مهنة مراقبة الحسابات</orig>. The request must be submitted through the (Public Shareholding Companies Portal - Account Auditors Section Services) within a maximum of seven working days from the date the result is announced, for a non-refundable fee of (25 K.D. <orig>25 د.ك</orig>) per subject.
- The Kuwait Association of Accountants and Auditors <orig>جمعية المحاسبين والمراجعين الكويتية</orig> holds a refresher course to help applicants prepare for the exam.
- The location and time of the exam will be determined one week before it is held and will be announced on the website of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

After reviewing the Constitution,
And Law No. 4 of 1962 concerning the exchange of letters, memoranda, and international agreements,
And the Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Iraq concerning the Regulation of Maritime Navigation in Khor Abdullah <orig>خور عبد الله</orig>, signed in the city of Baghdad on 28/4/2019,
And after the approval of the National Assembly <orig>مجلس الأمة</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

**Article One**

The Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Iraq concerning the Regulation of Maritime Navigation in Khor Abdullah <orig>خور عبد الله</orig>, signed in the city of Baghdad on 28/4/2019, attached to this decree <orig>مرسوم</orig>, has been approved.

**Article Two**

The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the ministers – each within his jurisdiction – shall implement this decree <orig>مرسوم</orig>, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

**Deputy Amir and Crown Prince**
**Nawaf Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>نواف الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

**Prime Minister**
**Sabah Khaled Al-Hamad Al-Sabah <orig>صباح خالد الحمد الصباح</orig>**

Issued at Seif Palace on: 2 Rajab 1442 H
Corresponding to: 14 February 2021 AD

**Law No. 4 of 2021**
**Approving the Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Iraq Concerning the Regulation of Maritime Navigation in Khor Abdullah <orig>خور عبد الله</orig>**

The National Assembly <orig>مجلس الأمة</orig> has approved the following law, which we have ratified and promulgated:

**Article One**

The Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Iraq concerning the Regulation of Maritime Navigation in Khor Abdullah <orig>خور عبد الله</orig>, signed in the city of Baghdad on 28/4/2019, has been approved.

**Article Two**

The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the ministers – each within his jurisdiction – shall implement this law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

**Amir of Kuwait**
**Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>صباح الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

Issued at Seif Palace on: 2 Rajab 1442 H
Corresponding to: 14 February 2021 AD

**Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>**
**Ministerial Decision No. 25 of 2021**
**Amending some provisions of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds**

**The Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>,**

- After reviewing Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds and its amendments,
- And Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بالقانون</orig> No. 116 of 1992 concerning the administrative organization and defining the competencies and authorities of government bodies,
- And Decree <orig>مرسوم</orig> No. 190 of 2000 concerning the administrative organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
- And the Executive Regulations of Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds, issued by Ministerial Decision No. 109 of 1994 and its amendments,
- And based on the submission of the Undersecretary of the Ministry,

**Has decided:**

**Article One**

The text of Article (2) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds shall be replaced with the following text:
"The entities subject to the provisions of Law No. 1 of 1993 referred to above shall provide the Ministry with the following data and documents:
1. A copy of the company's articles of incorporation and its articles of association, and any amendments thereto.
2. The names of the members of the board of directors, their nationalities, and the dates of their appointment.
3. The names of the managers, their nationalities, and the dates of their appointment.
4. The names of the auditors and the date of their appointment.
5. The balance sheet and the profit and loss account for the ended fiscal year, and the board of directors' report on the company's activities and financial position, and the auditors' report, within one week from the date of their approval by the general assembly.
6. The minutes of the general assembly meetings, within one week from the date of the meeting.
7. The minutes of the board of directors' meetings, within one week from the date of the meeting.
8. A statement of the names of the shareholders, their nationalities, and the number of shares owned by each, as of the end of the fiscal year, within one week from the date of approval of the balance sheet.
9. A statement of the names of the individuals who have obtained loans or credit facilities, and the value of the loan or facility for each, and the guarantees provided, as of the end of the fiscal year, within one week from the date of approval of the balance sheet.
10. Any other data or documents requested by the Ministry."

**Article Two**

A new article, No. (2 bis), shall be added to the Executive Regulations of Law No. 1 of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds, with the following text:
"The entities subject to the provisions of Law No. 1 of 1993 referred to above shall enable the Ministry's employees, who are designated by a decision from the Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>, to review the records, books, and documents to verify the correctness of the data and documents stipulated in the preceding article."

**Article Three**

This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its publication.

**Dr. Abdullah Issa Al-Salman <orig>د. عبد الله عيسى السلمان</orig>**
**Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>**

Issued on: 28 Jumada al-Akhirah 1442 H
Corresponding to: 10 February 2021 AD

# Announcement
## Regarding the launch of Tender No. S/M KH A/15/2024/2025
Replacement of central water chillers operating on a water-cooling system, along with their accessories, at the cooling station of Al-Amiri Hospital
At the request of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
Tender documents can be obtained from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

<table_caption>Tender No. S/M KH A/15/2024/2025 Details</table_caption>
<table>
| Launch | Scheduled Bid Submission Date (Closing Date) | Price | Guarantee |
|---|---|---|---|
| 12/10/2025 | 11/11/2025 | 300 | KWD 6,000, valid for 90 days, in favor of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> |
</table>

**Preliminary Meeting (Inquiry Session)** 10:00 AM on Tuesday, 21-10-2025, in the meeting hall at the Engineering Affairs and Projects Sector building, at the Ministry's main office building.

The tender documents will be published on the Agency's website for review before proceeding to purchase the documents.
- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the announcement above for bid submission.
- Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions for submitting and depositing bids on CD, which are available on the Agency's website: WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid by a certified check or K-Net card.
- Companies/bidders wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must submit them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified above in the schedule for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). Any inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Agency will not be considered.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, with the exception of the bid form and the initial guarantee, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Not divisible
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the bidder's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. It should be noted that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid-opening session.
- Companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department before the day scheduled for the bid-opening session and bring the following documents:
1. A copy of the Civil ID.
2. A copy of the signature authorization specific to the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. In the event that a person other than the authorized signatory attends, a written letter from the authorized signatory registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders must be provided, delegating whomever they see fit to attend the session.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the provisions of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to the Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the tender must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة و المتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is an integral part of the tender documents.
- For more information, please visit our website: WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW

# Announcement
## Regarding Practice: AM M 2/4/ 2025-2026
### Practice for the Appointment of a Senior Systems Analyst Specialist

The Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> announces an open internal practice by sealed envelope for the appointment of a Senior Systems Analyst Specialist, as per the following documents:

- Document (1-1) – General Conditions; Document (1-2) – Special Conditions
- Document (2-2) – Technical Conditions and Specifications; Document (3-2) – Bid Form; Document (3-6) – Schedule of Quantities and Prices; Document (5-1) – Appendix of Additional Conditions

1- These documents can be obtained from the Procurement and Warehouses Department at the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> during official working hours for a non-refundable fee of: KWD 75/- (Seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>). The documents will be handed over to the authorized representative of the company or establishment purchasing them, upon presentation of an official letter.
2- The deadline for submitting bids to the Procurement and Warehouses Department at the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig> is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 26/10/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.
3- The bidder is required to be a Kuwaiti company registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>جهاز المناقصات العامة</orig>.
4- The bidder is required to be a company that has executed similar projects in ministries and government entities in Kuwait and has at least ten years of business experience. Supporting documents must be attached.
5- The amount of the initial guarantee is 2% of the total value of the practitioner's bid. This guarantee must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional letter of guarantee issued by one of the approved Kuwaiti banks in favor of the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>. The bidder may not claim any interest on the amount of this guarantee.
6- The amount of the final guarantee is 10% of the total contract value, in the form of an unconditional letter of guarantee free of any reservations, issued by one of the approved banks in the State of Kuwait. The creditors of the Second Party may not seize the guarantee amount, and no interest shall be paid on it.
7- The contract execution period is: (1095 days / 36 months / 3 years).
8- The bid shall remain valid for a period of 90 days (ninety days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
9- The practice is not divisible.
10- Alternative offers will not be accepted.
11- This practice is open to all companies and establishments that hold an agency registration certificate issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, are qualified for this work, and are registered in the Ministry's Register of Contractors and with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025.
12- A preliminary meeting will be held for all those wishing to participate in this practice to answer their inquiries. The meeting will take place in the meeting room of the Information Systems Center Department at the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الاشغال العامة</orig> building in South Surra on Monday, 20/10/2025, at 11:00 AM. It should be noted that whether the practitioner attends the aforementioned meeting or not, they will be considered fully aware of all inquiries and the responses to them that were addressed in this meeting.

## Item Nineteen: Addition of a new article, numbered 56, which states
The addition of a new article, numbered 56, was approved, which states: -
The Board of Directors shall have a secretary from among the company's employees who shall record the minutes of the meetings, which shall be signed by him and by all members present. Everything that transpired in the meeting shall be recorded, especially any objections to any of the decisions taken by the Board and the reasons for the objection. He shall have the authority to sign certificates issued by the company regarding the decisions taken in the Board of Directors' meetings. The Board of Directors' meetings shall have a special register at the company in which the minutes of the meeting are recorded with consecutive numbers for the year in which the meeting was held, indicating the place, date, and start and end time of the meeting.
The Chairman of the session extended his thanks to the attendees. The meeting concluded at 11:30 AM.

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of The Champion Holding Company <orig>شركة ذي تشامبين القابضة</orig> – a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (Holding) – held its meeting at 12:30 PM on Monday, September 22, 2025, at the company's headquarters located in Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig>, Block 12, Plot 10000, Salem Al-Ali Street. The meeting was chaired by
Mr. Mahmoud Mohammed Majeed Al-Dosari <orig>محمود محمد مجيد الدوسري</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors. The meeting was attended by:

(The General Assembly may, upon the proposal of the Board of Directors, distribute profits to the shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. ## Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>
### Announcement of a Lost Certificate
Based on Ministerial Resolution No. (89/2000) issued on 13/6/2000 regarding the issuance of a replacement certificate (for a lost one).
We hereby inform you that the student / Shahad Abdullah Yousef Al-Shaji <orig>شهد عبد الله يوسف الشاجي</orig> - from Umm Al-Harith Al-Ansariya Secondary School for Girls, has lost her original certificate. A replacement certificate is being issued for her after publishing her name in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and providing proof thereof.
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education

## Announcement of a Lost Certificate
Pursuant to Ministerial Resolution No. (89/2000) issued on 13/06/2000 regarding the issuance of a replacement for a lost certificate.
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces that the student / Saleh Yassin Al-Aliwi <orig>صالح ياسين العليوي</orig> – Al-Najat Private Secondary School for Boys <orig>مدرسة النجاة الأهلية الثانوية للبنين</orig>, has lost his original certificate, and a replacement is being issued for him after publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>).
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education

# Announcement
## Regarding Tender No. (M M/29/2025-2026)
### Supply and Transport of Various Materials, Raw Materials, and Wood for the Needs of the General Technical Directorate for Practical Studies
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces a (public) tender for the supply and transport of various materials and raw materials in accordance with the technical conditions and specifications in the tender documents.
General Instructions for the Tender:
1- The tender is (public) for bidders accredited by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- Applicants for this tender must be institutions/companies specialized in the subject matter of the tender within Kuwait, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry for the current year. A certificate to this effect, dated concurrently with the tender announcement date, must be attached to the bid.
3- This tender is (divisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4- The fee for obtaining a copy of the tender documents is (75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.
5- The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary deposit of not less than (2%) of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, unconditional and unrestricted. Bids not accompanied by this deposit, or accompanied by a deposit that violates any of the aforementioned regulations, will be disregarded. The deposit must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
6- The total duration of the contract is 150 days from the date of signing the contract, during which the contractor is obligated to execute the tender works in accordance with the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the tender documents.
7- The bidder agrees that their bid shall remain valid and in effect, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be accepted after the bid has been submitted.
8- If, upon studying the tender, the bidder finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that affects the categories of their bid or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any). This shall not result in any additional liability or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
9- Tender documents must be deposited in the tender box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in the South Subhan area during official working hours, no later than (10) ten days from the date of publication of this announcement, at exactly (12:00 PM), in accordance with the Ministry's decision regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the scheduled closing time will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of submitted bids be considered after the bid has been submitted.
10- The bidder must fill out the attached schedules and provide a statement of all supplies necessary for the execution of the works subject to the tender – if any – within the same bid documents submitted. The Ministry has the right to reject a bid if it does not include the completed schedules, in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the tender.
11- The bidder must submit all bank guarantees related to this tender in the Arabic language.
12- Submission of samples is required.
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education

# Advertisement
The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Tender No. (L.Sh 2025-2026/66) for the supply, installation, operation, warranty, and maintenance of a guard monitoring system and its accessories for various departments within the Ministry of Interior, for the General Directorate of Security Systems at the Ministry of Interior.
Companies/institutions specialized in this field should contact the General Directorate of Financial Affairs, Tenders Department (in Ardiya Industrial Area), to obtain the tender documents for a non-refundable fee of KWD 20 (twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), payable via K-Net. A preliminary guarantee of KWD 2,800 (two thousand eight hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) must be submitted (to be placed in the financial bid for the tender). Note that the final insurance for the tender is 10% of the total contract value.
They must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), and the following documents:
- A valid registration receipt from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Or
- A registration request to register with the Ministry and then purchase the tender documents.
The closing date (submission of bids) is Wednesday, 29/10/2025, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the specified time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Bid Opening Committee of the Purchasing Committee at the Ministry of Interior building (Sharq area – Al-Siddiq School – first floor).
A mandatory preliminary meeting will be held with the participating companies on Tuesday, 07/10/2025, at the headquarters of the General Directorate of Security Systems at 10:00 AM to answer companies' inquiries. Note that any recommendations or decisions resulting from this meeting are considered an integral part of the tender documents and are binding on all companies, whether the bidder attended the mandatory preliminary meeting or not.

## Against:
1- Sulaiman Dawood Sulaiman Rasheed <orig>سليمان داود سليمان رشيد</orig>.
2- Talal Khalid Jassem Mansour <orig>طلال خالد جاسم منصور</orig>.
3- Director General of Kuwait Municipality <orig>مدير عام بلدية الكويت</orig>, in his capacity.
4- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice for Real Estate Registration and Notarization Affairs <orig>وكيل وزارة العدل لشئون التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig>, in his capacity.

## First: Description of the Property According to the Attached Description Certificate:
Property under Document No. 2023/1290, located in the Al-Qurain <orig>القرين</orig> area, Plot 6 <orig>قطعة 6</orig>, Parcel 215 <orig>قسيمة 215</orig>, Plan M/36942 <orig>مخطط م / 36942</orig>, with an area of 400 m², to be sold by public auction with a base price of (346,500 K.D.) three hundred forty-six thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** The description certificate states:
The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor + roof. Violations were found, consisting of a canopy made of light materials on the first floor at the rear, an unlicensed elevator built on the ground, first, second, and roof levels, and an additional structure on the first and second floors on the service road side (courtyard). A violation report No. 24881 was issued.
** And according to the expert's report:
On 05/02/2024, the expert proceeded to inspect the property subject of the lawsuit, located in the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area, Plot 6 <orig>قطعة 6</orig>, Street 7, Parcel No. 215, House 6, with automated address No. 13255387. This was done in the presence and with the guidance of the plaintiffs' agent and the first defendant himself. The technical expert, retained by the administration, was also present to inspect the property in preparation for its valuation. After examination and inspection, the expert found the following:

## General Description of the Disputed Property
The property subject of the lawsuit is located in the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area, Plot 6 <orig>قطعة 6</orig>, Street 7, House No. 6, Parcel No. 215, with automated address No. 13255387. The property is situated on a single street and has a setback consisting of parking for 3 cars. It also has an island in front of the property belonging to it, which consists of parking for 2 cars. The exterior cladding of the disputed property is beige Sigma. The property consists of a ground floor, first floor, and a roof, and has 2 main iron entrances.

## Specific Description of the Disputed Property
Following the guidance of the first defendant, the expert inspected the interior of the property. The ground floor consists of a hall, a bathroom attached to the hall, a room, a kitchen, an annex, and a bathroom attached to the annex. The external courtyard consists of a diwaniya, a bathroom for the diwaniya, a maid's room, and a storeroom. The first floor has 4 rooms, two halls, a kitchen, and 3 bathrooms. The roof consists of a kitchen, a hall, two rooms, and a bathroom. The property subject of the lawsuit conforms to the document submitted to the expert. The technical expert recorded the general and specific descriptions of the property in preparation for its valuation.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at his own risk during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with an increase of one-tenth, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the one-tenth increase, the bidding is immediately reopened at his own risk, based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and on their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
## Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a fair market rent."

Vice President of the Court of First Instance

First: Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's description certificate.
The property of Document No. 1999/11844, located in the Hittin <orig>حطين</orig> area – Plot No. 541 – Block No. 3 – from Plan No. M/32904, with an area of 437.5 m², to be sold at public auction with a base price of KWD 620,000 (six hundred and twenty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** A violation was noted on the property, which is a building addition on the roof of the first floor.
** And according to the attached expert's report
– In the session of 04/09/2023, the subject of the dispute was visited and inspected on-site, located in the Hittin <orig>حطين</orig> area – Block (3) – Street No. (311) – Plot (541) – House No. (24). This was done in the presence and with the guidance of the plaintiff, and in the presence of Mr. Sami Al-Tarawneh <orig>سامي الطراورة</orig>, an expert from the administration. The rest of the litigants failed to attend. The inspection was carried out as follows:
The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residence overlooking a main street, "Subaih Barrak Al-Subaih" <orig>صبيح براك الصبيح</orig>, opposite the Al-Shuhada <orig>الشهداء</orig> area, with an area of 437.5 m² (according to Document No. 1999/11844). It has one entrance, a setback in front, and is bordered by neighbors on the right, left, and rear.
– The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a yard.
– The door was knocked, but no one answered. The plaintiff provided information about the property's components from the outside, stating that the ground floor consists of a hall, a small hall, two (2) bedrooms, two (2) bathrooms, a main kitchen, and a maid's room with its bathroom. The exterior cladding is 'Sabsijma' <orig>السبسيجما</orig>, and there is an elevator and central air conditioning. He was unable to guide the expert on the remaining components of the property.

We, along with the due diligence expert, inspected the property from the outside, and the due diligence expert collected the data related to the property.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction begins at the base price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction is reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction is immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

President of the Court of First Instance

## Announcement

The Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces the issuance of the tenders listed below. Tender documents can be obtained electronically from the website https://eprocurement.mew.gov.kw.

- **Issuance Date:** 12/10/2025
- **Closing Date:** 16/11/2025
- **Document Price:** As stated on the website and in the attached table.
- **Initial Deposit:** As stated on the website and in the attached table, valid for 90 days in favor of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> and is non-refundable.
- **Final Time for Submission of Bids:** At exactly 10:30 AM on the day specified in the announcement below for the submission of bids. No bid received after this time will be accepted.

The General Secretariat <orig>الأمانة العامة</orig> announces its desire to re-issue Auction No. (1-2025/2026-A) for the operation of a light-snack cafeteria in the building of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>. 5. A preliminary meeting will be held with the bidders on Wednesday, 15/10/2025, at 10:00 AM in the building of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>.

# Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig>

# Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>
## Announcement
# Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects
## Announcement of short-listed Companies and Consortia for Al Dibdibah Power and Al Shagaya Renewable Energy – Phase III – Zone 2 Solar PV IPP

Announcement of the qualification results for companies and consortia that submitted qualification applications for the Al-Dibdibah Power Generation Project <orig>مشروع الدبدبة لتوليد الطاقة الكهربائية</orig> and the Al-Shagaya Renewable Energy Project <orig>مشروع الشقايا للطاقة المتجددة</orig> – Phase III – Zone 2 (PV), in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 39 of 2010 concerning the establishment of Kuwaiti public shareholding companies to build and execute power plants and water desalination in the State of Kuwait, its amendments, and its executive regulations, and Law No. 116 of 2014 concerning Public-Private Partnerships and its executive regulations. With reference to the announcement published in the Kuwait Today <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> gazette, issue No. 1739, dated 18/5/2025, regarding the invitation to submit qualification applications for the Al-Dibdibah Power Generation Project <orig>مشروع الدبدبة لتوليد الطاقة الكهربائية</orig> and the Al-Shagaya Renewable Energy Project <orig>مشروع الشقايا للطاقة المتجددة</orig> – Phase III – Zone 2, the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>, in cooperation with the Ministry of Electricity & Water & Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> and the Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig>, is pleased to announce the evaluation results of the companies/consortia approved to participate in the next stage of the aforementioned project tender, which are as follows:

In accordance with Law No. 39/2010 and its Executive Regulations, Law No. 116/2014 and its Executive Regulations, With reference to the announcement published in Kuwait Gazette, issue No. 1739, issued on 18/5/2025, regarding the request of qualification for Al Dibdibah Power and AlShagaya Renewable Energy – Phase III – Zone 2 Solar PV IPP (the “Project”)., the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects (“KAPP”) in collaboration with the Ministry of Electricity & Water & Renewable Energy of the State of Kuwait and Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research are pleased to announce the short-listed companies/consortia following the pre-qualification stage for the Project.

The following companies and consortia are pleased to announce the short-listed companies/consortia following the pre-qualification stage for the Project.

The following companies and consortia are:

# Announcement
The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the offering of Bid No. (2025/2026-T1-52) for the management and operation of a restaurant for Unit No. (PM205) (light meals) in Terminal 1 at Kuwait International Airport.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule for Bid No. 2025/2026-T1-52</table_caption>
<table>
| Preliminary Meeting | Site Visit | Price | Closing | Offering |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| At 11:00 AM on (Tuesday), corresponding to (29/10/2025), at the headquarters of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, Financial Affairs Department. | Monday, corresponding to (28/10/2025) at (11:00 AM) | 500 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> | Monday, corresponding to (17/11/2025) | Sunday, corresponding to (12/10/2025) |
</table>

This is based on the request of Civil Aviation. Bidding documents can be obtained from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> – Financial Affairs Department – Tenders and Contracts Section – Kuwait International Airport, according to the details shown below.
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid via K-Net, Visa, or Mastercard.
- The company must be registered with the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> at the time of bid submission.
- A preliminary deposit of not less than (2%) and not more than (5%) of the bid value must be submitted in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by an accredited bank in the State of Kuwait.
- The documents, after being completed and with the required documents enclosed, shall be returned in an official envelope sealed with red wax. Bids will be submitted to the Tenders and Contracts Section – Financial Affairs Department at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
- The deadline for submitting bids is Monday (17/11/2025) at 1:00 PM at the headquarters of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
- The location for receiving envelopes is at the main administration building in Subhan – Ground Floor – Bid Receiving Room.

Requesting approval to complete the economic concentration transaction
The acquisition by Al Thiqa Restaurants Company S.P.C. <orig>شركة الثقة للمطاعم ش.ش.و.</orig> (the Parent Company) of 99% of the capital of Cloud Nine Peaks for Retail Sale of Foodstuffs W.L.L. <orig>كلاود ناين بيكس للبيع بالتجزئة للمواد الغذائية ذ.م.م.</orig>, and the acquisition by Al Thiqa Al Kuwaitia for Restaurants Management W.L.L. <orig>شركة الثقة الكويتية لإدارة المطاعم ذ.م.م.</orig> (the Subsidiary Company) of 1% of the capital of Cloud Nine Peaks for Retail Sale of Foodstuffs W.L.L. <orig>شركة كلاود ناين بيكس للبيع بالتجزئة للمواد الغذائية ذ.م.م.</orig>.

In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection <orig>القانون رقم (72) لسنة 2020 في شأن حماية المنافسة</orig> and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Decision No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which states that "Any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Agency regarding the economic concentration request within a period not exceeding (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication...".
Accordingly, the Agency invites any interested party to submit its reasoned objection to this economic concentration within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of this announcement.
Objection details shall be submitted at the headquarters of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, Al Hamra Tower <orig>برج الحمراء</orig>, Floor (14), by filling out the form available on the website, along with payment of the prescribed fee.

Acquisition by Sidara Limited (United Kingdom) <orig>شركة سيدارا ليمتد (المملكة المتحدة)</orig>, owned by Dar Al-Handasah for Design and Technical Consulting (Shair and Partners) Holding Limited <orig>شركة دار الهندسة للتصميم والاستشارات الفنية شاعر ومشاركوه القابضة المحدودة</orig>, of 100% of John Wood Group PLC (Scotland) <orig>شركة جون وود جروب بي إل سي (اسكتلندا)</orig>.
In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Resolution No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which states that "Any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Agency regarding the economic concentration request within a period not exceeding (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication..."
Accordingly, the Agency invites any interested party to submit its reasoned objection to this economic concentration within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of this announcement.
Data related to objections shall be submitted at the headquarters of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, at Al Hamra Tower <orig>برج الحمراء</orig>, Floor (14), by filling out the form available on the website, along with payment of the prescribed fee.

## Announcement

The Medical Liability Authority <orig>جهاز المسؤولية الطبية</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. J M T/M S/2025/2026/11 for the provision of security and guarding services for the Medical Liability Authority building, according to the following details:

Companies and institutions wishing to participate in this tender may purchase and obtain the tender documents by visiting the main headquarters of the Medical Liability Authority <orig>جهاز المسؤولية الطبية</orig>, for the specified fee. Any bid not accompanied by the original initial guarantee, a valid National Labor Support Certificate issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>, a valid Certificate of Clearance <orig>شهادة براءة ذمة</orig> issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> within its bid contents stating that there are no stop codes related to the labor registered in its file with the Authority, and a certificate of payment of contributions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات</orig> will be excluded.

# Statement of Decisions of the Higher Purchasing Committee Meeting No. (2025/110) held on 30/9/2025

The Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries held its meeting at 12:30 PM on Tuesday, at Hall No. (2) GUEST HOUSE in the Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig> Guest House, after the quorum was complete, in the presence of the esteemed members of the Committee, the Committee's Secretariat, and representatives of the concerned parties.

The Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC) <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> – Internal Purchasing Committee (I.P.C) <orig>لجنة الشراء الداخلية</orig>, announces the issuance of Tender No. MNA/14/2025 concerning Electrical Motor Overhauling and Rewinding For Polypropylene Plant

<table_caption>Tender Details for MNA/14/2025</table_caption>
<table>

</table>

- This tender is limited and non-divisible among the companies listed in the table below.
- Brief description of the tender works:
  The scope will cover electrical low voltage three phases, single phase 415V AC, high voltage 6.6 KV motors and Refrigeration compressors overhaul and rewinding.
- The closing date for the tender is at 1:00 PM on Sunday, 16/11/2025. Bids must be submitted to the electronic platform (K-Tendering). No copy of the bid should be sent to any other entity except the aforementioned email, otherwise the bid will be considered void. The bid validity period is (90) days from the date of opening the tender envelopes. No bids will be accepted after the specified day.
- The preliminary meeting is scheduled for 10:00 AM on Monday, 27/10/2025. Please note that the meeting will be held virtually (Virtual Meeting).
- An initial guarantee in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and for the benefit of the Petrochemical Industries Company, in the amount of (750/-) seven hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, with the same validity period as the bid, must be submitted. The original guarantee must be submitted sufficiently in advance of the closing date, and a soft copy must be attached to the bid.
- The original initial bank guarantee, with the value specified in this announcement, must be delivered to the Sub-Committee for Opening Tender Envelopes <orig>اللجنة الفرعية لفض مظاريف العطاءات</orig> before the specified closing time for the tender, at the company's main headquarters in South Sabahiya, office number (110-FG), with a soft copy required to be attached to the bid.
- The deadline for submitting any inquiries, reservations, or requests by participating companies regarding this tender is 30/10/2025. Such requests will not be considered for any reason after this specified date.
- The purchase price for the document is an amount of (50/-) fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- The documents can be purchased via bank deposit into the account of the Petrochemical Industries Company, ensuring that the aforementioned tender number and the purchasing company's name are clearly stated on the purchase receipt issued by the bank, according to the following details:
